A1-009.name: Kakuna
A1-009.description: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.

A1-002.name: Ivysaur
A1-002.description: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

A1-003.name: Venusaur
A1-003.description: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

A1-007.name: Butterfree
A1-007.description: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

abilities.name: Powder Heal
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

A1-006.name: Metapod
A1-006.description: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.

A1-012.name: Gloom
A1-012.description: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

A1-013.name: Vileplume
A1-013.description: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

A1-015.name: Parasect
A1-015.description: The bug is mostly dead, with the mushroom on its back having become the main body. If the mushroom comes off, the bug stops moving.

A1-011.name: Oddish
A1-011.description: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

A1-008.name: Weedle
A1-008.description: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

A1-014.name: Paras
A1-014.description: The mushrooms, known as tochukaso, are controlling the bug. Even if the bug bugs the mushrooms, they tell it to bug off.

A1-016.name: Venonat
A1-016.description: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches small bug Pokémon at night that are attracted by light.

A1-001.name: Bulbasaur
A1-001.description: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.

A1-005.name: Caterpie
A1-005.description: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.effect: Put 1 random {G} Pokémon from your deck into your hand.

A1-010.name: Beedrill
A1-010.description: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

A1-019.name: Weepinbell
A1-019.description: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.

A1-020.name: Victreebel
A1-020.description: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

abilities.name: Fragrance Trap
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, once during your turn, you may switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon to the Active Spot.

A1-021.name: Exeggcute
A1-021.description: Though it may look like it's just a bunch of eggs, it's a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

A1-022.name: Exeggutor
A1-022.description: Each of Exeggutor's three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don't seem to be very interested in one another.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

A1-018.name: Bellsprout
A1-018.description: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

attacks.name: Tropical Swing
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

A1-017.name: Venomoth
A1-017.description: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A1-024.name: Tangela
A1-024.description: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon's true appearance remains a mystery.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.effect: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

A1-025.name: Scyther
A1-025.description: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

A1-027.name: Cottonee
A1-027.description: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.

A1-028.name: Whimsicott
A1-028.description: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it'll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.

A1-032.name: Gogoat
A1-032.description: It can sense the feelings of others by touching them with its horns. This species has assisted people with their work since 5,000 years ago.

A1-026.name: Pinsir
A1-026.description: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.

attacks.name: Double Horn
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

A1-030.name: Lilligant
A1-030.description: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very difficult.

attacks.name: Leaf Supply
attacks.effect: Take a {G} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched {G} Pokémon.

A1-031.name: Skiddo
A1-031.description: Until recently, people living in the mountains would ride on the backs of these Pokémon to traverse the mountain paths.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A1-029.name: Petilil
A1-029.description: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.effect: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crimson Storm
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

A1-035.name: Charizard
A1-035.description: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

A1-037.name: Vulpix
A1-037.description: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

A1-038.name: Ninetales
A1-038.description: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.effect: Discard 1 {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Inferno Onrush
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A1-033.name: Charmander
A1-033.description: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.effect: Discard a {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

A1-039.name: Growlithe
A1-039.description: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

A1-042.name: Ponyta
A1-042.description: It can't run properly when it's newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.

A1-040.name: Arcanine
A1-040.description: An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A1-043.name: Rapidash
A1-043.description: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.

A1-034.name: Charmeleon
A1-034.description: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

A1-045.name: Flareon
A1-045.description: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.effect: Discard 1 {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

A1-048.name: Heatmor
A1-048.description: There's a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.

A1-046.name: Moltres
A1-046.description: It's one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.

attacks.name: Sky Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Inferno Dance
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. Take an amount of {R} Energy from your Energy Zone equal to the number of heads and attach it to your Benched {R} Pokémon in any way you like.

A1-044.name: Magmar
A1-044.description: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.

A1-049.name: Salandit
A1-049.description: It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.

A1-050.name: Salazzle
A1-050.description: Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.

A1-052.name: Centiskorch
A1-052.description: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.effect: Discard a {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

A1-053.name: Squirtle
A1-053.description: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.

A1-055.name: Blastoise
A1-055.description: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

A1-059.name: Poliwag
A1-059.description: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon's innards showing through the skin.

attacks.name: Hydro Bazooka
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

A1-054.name: Wartortle
A1-054.description: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.

A1-058.name: Golduck
A1-058.description: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.

A1-057.name: Psyduck
A1-057.description: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.effect: Your opponent can't use any Supporter cards from their hand during their next turn.

A1-051.name: Sizzlipede
A1-051.description: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

A1-061.name: Poliwrath
A1-061.description: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, do 20 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

A1-060.name: Poliwhirl
A1-060.description: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl's has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.

A1-062.name: Tentacool
A1-062.description: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.

A1-063.name: Tentacruel
A1-063.description: When the red orbs on Tentacruel's head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.

attacks.name: Poison Tentacles
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A1-064.name: Seel
A1-064.description: Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don't bother it at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in warm waters.

A1-065.name: Dewgong
A1-065.description: It sunbathes on the beach after meals. The rise in its body temperature helps its digestion.

A1-067.name: Cloyster
A1-067.description: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes -10 damage from attacks.

A1-066.name: Shellder
A1-066.description: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.

A1-069.name: Kingler
A1-069.description: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

attacks.name: KO Crab
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 80 more damage.

A1-068.name: Krabby
A1-068.description: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.

A1-075.name: Starmie
A1-075.description: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.

A1-073.name: Seaking
A1-073.description: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A1-070.name: Horsea
A1-070.description: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.

A1-072.name: Goldeen
A1-072.description: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.

A1-074.name: Staryu
A1-074.description: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you'll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.

A1-071.name: Seadra
A1-071.description: It's the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.effect: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A1-077.name: Magikarp
A1-077.description: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.

A1-079.name: Lapras
A1-079.description: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 70 more damage.

A1-078.name: Gyarados
A1-078.description: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.effect: Discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A1-080.name: Vaporeon
A1-080.description: It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

A1-081.name: Omanyte
A1-081.description: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.effect: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A1-085.name: Ducklett
A1-085.description: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

A1-082.name: Omastar
A1-082.description: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn't move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.

attacks.name: Ancient Whirlpool
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack.

A1-083.name: Articuno
A1-083.description: It's said that this Pokémon's beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

A1-088.name: Frogadier
A1-088.description: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

A1-090.name: Pyukumuku
A1-090.description: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.

A1-089.name: Greninja
A1-089.description: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

abilities.name: Water Shuriken
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may do 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A1-087.name: Froakie
A1-087.description: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

A1-086.name: Swanna
A1-086.description: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.

A1-091.name: Bruxish
A1-091.description: It grinds its teeth with great force to stimulate its brain. It fires the psychic energy created by this process from the protuberance on its head.

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

A1-092.name: Snom
A1-092.description: It eats snow that has accumulated on the ground. It prefers soft, freshly fallen snow, so it will eat its way up a mountain, aiming for the peak.

A1-093.name: Frosmoth
A1-093.description: Frosmoth senses air currents with its antennae. It sends its scales drifting on frigid air, making them fall like snow.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Circle Circuit
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Benched {L} Pokémon.

A1-095.name: Raichu
A1-095.description: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.effect: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

A1-094.name: Pikachu
A1-094.description: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

A1-098.name: Magneton
A1-098.description: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

abilities.name: Volt Charge
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

A1-097.name: Magnemite
A1-097.description: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

A1-099.name: Voltorb
A1-099.description: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

A1-100.name: Electrode
A1-100.description: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.

A1-101.name: Electabuzz
A1-101.description: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.

attacks.name: Thunder Punch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A1-102.name: Jolteon
A1-102.description: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

A1-103.name: Zapdos
A1-103.description: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.effect: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thundering Hurricane
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

A1-107.name: Tynamo
A1-107.description: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

A1-105.name: Blitzle
A1-105.description: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

A1-108.name: Eelektrik
A1-108.description: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

A1-106.name: Zebstrika
A1-106.description: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A1-109.name: Eelektross
A1-109.description: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

A1-110.name: Helioptile
A1-110.description: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon's electric moves.

A1-111.name: Heliolisk
A1-111.description: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

A1-112.name: Pincurchin
A1-112.description: This Pokémon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

A1-114.name: Clefable
A1-114.description: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.

A1-113.name: Clefairy
A1-113.description: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

A1-115.name: Abra
A1-115.description: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra's dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A1-116.name: Kadabra
A1-116.description: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.

A1-118.name: Slowpoke
A1-118.description: It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

A1-119.name: Slowbro
A1-119.description: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.

A1-120.name: Gastly
A1-120.description: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

A1-117.name: Alakazam
A1-117.description: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A1-121.name: Haunter
A1-121.description: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

abilities.name: Shadowy Spellbind
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't use any Supporter cards from their hand.

A1-124.name: Drowzee
A1-124.description: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.

A1-122.name: Gengar
A1-122.description: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.

attacks.name: Bother
attacks.effect: Your opponent can't use any Supporter cards from their hand during their next turn.

A1-125.name: Hypno
A1-125.description: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves, such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

abilities.name: Sleep Pendulum
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

A1-126.name: Mr. Mime
A1-126.description: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes -20 damage from attacks.

A1-127.name: Jynx
A1-127.description: Its strange cries sound like human language. There are some musicians who compose songs for Jynx to sing.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A1-128.name: Mewtwo
A1-128.description: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {P} Energy from this Pokémon.

A1-130.name: Ralts
A1-130.description: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people's emotions.

A1-131.name: Kirlia
A1-131.description: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

A1-132.name: Gardevoir
A1-132.description: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

abilities.name: Psy Shadow
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may take 1 {P} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to the {P} Pokémon in the Active Spot.

attacks.name: Psydrive
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {P} Energy from this Pokémon.

A1-133.name: Woobat
A1-133.description: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it's evidence that Woobat live there.

A1-134.name: Swoobat
A1-134.description: Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out. Afterward, it won't be able to fly for a little while.

A1-135.name: Golett
A1-135.description: They were sculpted from clay in ancient times. No one knows why, but some of them are driven to continually line up boulders.

A1-136.name: Golurk
A1-136.description: Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient castles served as perches from which Golurk could fire energy beams.

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

A1-137.name: Sandshrew
A1-137.description: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.

A1-139.name: Diglett
A1-139.description: It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

A1-141.name: Mankey
A1-141.description: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.

A1-138.name: Sandslash
A1-138.description: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon's spikes will feel when touched.

A1-140.name: Dugtrio
A1-140.description: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent’s next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

A1-142.name: Primeape
A1-142.description: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.

attacks.name: Fight Back
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

A1-145.name: Machamp
A1-145.description: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

A1-144.name: Machoke
A1-144.description: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

A1-143.name: Machop
A1-143.description: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

A1-150.name: Onix
A1-150.description: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.

A1-148.name: Graveler
A1-148.description: It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit, it rolls back down the way it came.

A1-147.name: Geodude
A1-147.description: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all their edges smoothed out until they're totally round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.

A1-152.name: Marowak
A1-152.description: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.

A1-151.name: Cubone
A1-151.description: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.effect: During your opponent’s next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do −20 damage.

A1-155.name: Hitmonchan
A1-155.description: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.

A1-149.name: Golem
A1-149.description: When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their shells. Those that have lived a long, long time have shells green with moss.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

A1-154.name: Hitmonlee
A1-154.description: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A1-156.name: Rhyhorn
A1-156.description: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.

A1-157.name: Rhydon
A1-157.description: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.

A1-158.name: Kabuto
A1-158.description: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.

A1-159.name: Kabutops
A1-159.description: Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.effect: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A1-161.name: Mienshao
A1-161.description: When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging opponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the fur on its arms.

A1-160.name: Mienfoo
A1-160.description: In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop with its arms more than 100 times.

A1-162.name: Clobbopus
A1-162.description: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

A1-163.name: Grapploct
A1-163.description: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.effect: Switch out your opponent’s Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

A1-164.name: Ekans
A1-164.description: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.

A1-165.name: Arbok
A1-165.description: The latest research has determined that there are over 20 possible arrangements of the patterns on its stomach.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

A1-166.name: Nidoran♀
A1-166.description: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they'll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.effect: Put 1 random Nidoran♂ from your deck onto your Bench.

A1-167.name: Nidorina
A1-167.description: The horn on its head has atrophied. It's thought that this happens so Nidorina's children won't get poked while their mother is feeding them.

A1-168.name: Nidoqueen
A1-168.description: Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield its children from any kind of attack.

attacks.name: Lovestrike
attacks.effect: This attack does 50 more damage for each of your Benched Nidoking.

A1-169.name: Nidoran♂
A1-169.description: The horn on a male Nidoran's forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.

A1-171.name: Nidoking
A1-171.description: When it goes on a rampage, it's impossible to control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it's lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A1-170.name: Nidorino
A1-170.description: With a horn that's harder than diamond, this Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone.

A1-172.name: Zubat
A1-172.description: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.

A1-173.name: Golbat
A1-173.description: It loves to drink other creatures' blood. It's said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it's gathered.

A1-174.name: Grimer
A1-174.description: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A1-175.name: Muk
A1-175.description: It's thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

A1-176.name: Koffing
A1-176.description: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

A1-178.name: Mawile
A1-178.description: It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into complacency, then bites with its huge, relentless jaws.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A1-177.name: Weezing
A1-177.description: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

abilities.name: Gas Leak
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.

A1-179.name: Pawniard
A1-179.description: Pawniard will fearlessly challenge even powerful foes. In a pinch, it will cling to opponents and pierce them with the blades all over its body.

A1-180.name: Bisharp
A1-180.description: This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.

A1-182.name: Melmetal
A1-182.description: At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.

abilities.name: Hard Coat
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes -20 damage from attacks.

A1-181.name: Meltan
A1-181.description: It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid metal within its body is how it generates energy.

attacks.name: Amass
attacks.effect: Take 1 {M} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

A1-183.name: Dratini
A1-183.description: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.

A1-184.name: Dragonair
A1-184.description: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

A1-185.name: Dragonite
A1-185.description: It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.

attacks.name: Draco Meteor
attacks.effect: 1 of your opponent's Pokémon is chosen at random 4 times. For each time a Pokémon was chosen, do 50 damage to it.

A1-187.name: Pidgeotto
A1-187.description: The claws on its feet are well developed. It can carry prey such as an Exeggcute to its nest over 60 miles away.

A1-189.name: Rattata
A1-189.description: Its incisors grow continuously throughout its life. If its incisors get too long, this Pokémon becomes unable to eat, and it starves to death.

A1-190.name: Raticate
A1-190.description: People say that it fled from its enemies by using its small webbed hind feet to swim from island to island in Alola.

A1-188.name: Pidgeot
A1-188.description: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

abilities.name: Drive Off
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

A1-191.name: Spearow
A1-191.description: Its reckless nature leads it to stand up to others—even large Pokémon—if it has to protect its territory.

A1-192.name: Fearow
A1-192.description: Carrying food through Fearow's territory is dangerous. It will snatch the food away from you in a flash!

attacks.name: Drill Run
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A1-193.name: Jigglypuff
A1-193.description: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

A1-194.name: Wigglytuff
A1-194.description: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.

attacks.name: Sleepy Song
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

A1-198.name: Farfetch'd
A1-198.description: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

A1-196.name: Meowth
A1-196.description: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.effect: Draw a card.

A1-201.description: If this Pokémon's sticky saliva gets on you and you don't clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won't go away, either.

attacks.name: Continuous Lick
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

A1-200.name: Dodrio
A1-200.description: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads—even for a second—will get pecked severely.

A1-199.name: Doduo
A1-199.description: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.

A1-202.name: Chansey
A1-202.description: This kindly Pokémon lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

A1-204.name: Tauros
A1-204.description: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it's a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.

A1-203.name: Kangaskhan
A1-203.description: Although it's carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.

attacks.name: Dizzy Punch
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

A1-206.name: Eevee
A1-206.description: Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

A1-208.name: Eevee
A1-208.description: Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

A1-205.name: Ditto
A1-205.description: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise.

A1-211.description: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

A1-212.description: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.

A1-210.description: This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.

A1-213.description: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won't tolerate even a speck of the stuff.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

A1-215.description: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You'll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.

Play this card as if it were a 40-HP Basic {C} Pokémon.
At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play.

A1-209.description: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.

A1-197.description: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

A1A-001.name: Exeggcute
A1A-001.description: Though it may look like it's just a bunch of eggs, it's a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

A1A-007.name: Morelull
A1A-007.description: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull's head. The caps regrow overnight.

A1A-008.description: Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

A2-032.name: Piloswine

A2-051.description: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

A2-052.name: Magneton
A2-052.description: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

A2-053.name: Magnezone
A2-053.description: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.effect: Discard a {L} Energy from this Pokémon.

A2-054.name: Voltorb
A2-054.description: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

attacks.name: Big Explosion
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

A2-055.name: Electrode
A2-055.description: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.

A2-056.name: Electabuzz
A2-056.description: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

A2-057.name: Electivire
A2-057.description: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.

attacks.name: Exciting Voltage
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {L} Energy attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

A2-058.name: Shinx
A2-058.description: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

A2-059.name: Luxio
A2-059.description: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

A2-060.name: Luxray
A2-060.description: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.

attacks.name: Volt Bolt
attacks.effect: Discard all {L} Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sparking Gadget
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

A2-062.name: Rotom
A2-062.description: Its electricity-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.

attacks.name: Assault Laser
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 30 more damage.

A2-063.name: Togepi
A2-063.description: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

A2-064.name: Togetic
A2-064.description: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.

A2-065.name: Togekiss
A2-065.description: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they've hardly been seen at all.

attacks.name: Overdrive Smash
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Overdrive Smash attack does +60 damage.

attacks.name: Magical Delusion
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

A2-066.name: Misdreavus
A2-066.description: This Pokémon startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

A2-069.name: Kirlia
A2-069.description: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

A2-068.name: Ralts
A2-068.description: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people's emotions.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A2-071.name: Dusclops
A2-071.description: It seeks drifting will-o'-the-wisps and sucks them into its empty body. What happens inside is a mystery.

A2-070.name: Duskull
A2-070.description: If it finds bad children who won't listen to their parents, it will spirit them away—or so it's said.

A2-073.name: Drifloon
A2-073.description: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

A2-074.name: Drifblim
A2-074.description: Some say this Pokémon is a collection of souls burdened with regrets, silently drifting through the dusk.

A2-072.name: Dusknoir
A2-072.description: At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit world, it steals people and Pokémon away. No one knows whether it has a will of its own.

abilities.name: Shadow Void
abilities.effect: As often as you like during your turn, you may choose 1 of your Pokémon that has damage on it, and move all of its damage to this Pokémon.

A2-075.name: Uxie
A2-075.description:
Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said
that it can wipe out the memory of those who see
its eyes.

attacks.name: Mind Boost
attacks.effect: Take a {P} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to Mesprit or Azelf.

A2-078.name: Giratina
A2-078.description: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

A2-076.name: Mesprit
A2-076.description:
Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught
humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

attacks.name: Supreme Blast
attacks.effect: You can use this attack only if you have Uxie and Azelf on your Bench. Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

A2-079.name: Cresselia
A2-079.description: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

attacks.name: Moonlight Gain
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

A2-077.name: Azelf
A2-077.description:
Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the
bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

attacks.name: Psychic Arrow
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A2-080.name: Rhyhorn
A2-080.description: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.

A2-082.name: Rhyperior
A2-082.description: It can load up to three projectiles per arm into the holes in its hands. What launches out of those holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.

attacks.name: Mountain Swing
attacks.effect: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

A2-083.name: Gligar
A2-083.description: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.

A2-081.name: Rhydon
A2-081.description: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.

A2-084.name: Gliscor
A2-084.description: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

A2-085.name: Hitmontop
A2-085.description: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

A2-086.name: Nosepass
A2-086.description: It moves less than an inch a year, but when it's in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.

A2-089.name: Rampardos
A2-089.description: In ancient times, people would dig up fossils of this Pokémon and use its skull, which is harder than steel, to make helmets.

attacks.name: Head Smash
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, this Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

A2-087.name: Regirock
A2-087.description: Every bit of Regirock's body is made of stone. As parts of its body erode, this Pokémon sticks rocks to itself to repair what's been lost.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

A2-088.name: Cranidos
A2-088.description: A primeval Pokémon, it possesses a hard and sturdy skull, lacking any intelligence within.

A2-091.name: Riolu
A2-091.description: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.

A2-090.name: Wormadam
A2-090.description: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.

A2-092.name: Lucario
A2-092.description: It's said that no foe can remain invisible to Lucario, since it can detect auras—even those of foes it could not otherwise see.

abilities.name: Fighting Coach
abilities.effect: Attacks used by your {F} Pokémon do +20 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A2-093.name: Hippopotas
A2-093.description: It shuts its nostrils tight, then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around 10.

attacks.name: Energized Blade
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A2-096.name: Murkrow
A2-096.description: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

A2-094.name: Hippowdon
A2-094.description: It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.

A2-097.name: Honchkrow
A2-097.description: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.effect: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A2-098.name: Sneasel
A2-098.description: This cunning Pokémon hides under the cover of darkness, waiting to attack its prey.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

A2-100.name: Poochyena
A2-100.description: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.

attacks.name: Scratching Nails
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

A2-102.name: Stunky
A2-102.description: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

A2-101.name: Mightyena
A2-101.description: It will always obey the commands of a skilled Trainer. Its behavior arises from its living in packs in ancient times.

A2-103.name: Skuntank
A2-103.description: It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A2-104.name: Spiritomb
A2-104.description: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.

attacks.name: Swirling Disaster
attacks.effect: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

A2-107.name: Croagunk
A2-107.description: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

attacks.name: Group Beatdown
attacks.effect: Flip a coin for each Pokémon you have in play. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

A2-106.name: Drapion
A2-106.description: Its poison is potent, but it rarely sees use. This Pokémon prefers to use physical force instead, going on rampages with its car-crushing strength.

attacks.name: Cross Poison
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads. If at least 2 of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A2-105.name: Skorupi
A2-105.description: After burrowing into the sand, it waits patiently for prey to come near. This Pokémon and Sizzlipede share common descent.

A2-108.name: Toxicroak
A2-108.description: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.

attacks.name: Group Beatdown
attacks.effect: Flip a coin for each Pokémon you have in play. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

A2-109.name: Darkrai
A2-109.description: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.

attacks.name: Dark Void
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

A2-111.name: Skarmory
A2-111.description: People fashion swords from Skarmory's shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.

attacks.name: Metal Arms
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 30 more damage.

A2-112.name: Registeel
A2-112.description: Registeel's body is made of a strange material that is flexible enough to stretch and shrink but also more durable than any metal.

abilities.name: Nightmare Aura
abilities.effect: Whenever you attach a {D} Energy from your Energy Zone to this Pokémon, do 20 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A2-113.name: Shieldon
A2-113.description: A mild-mannered, herbivorous Pokémon, it used its face to dig up tree roots to eat. The skin on its face was plenty tough.

A2-114.name: Bastiodon
A2-114.description: The bones of its face are huge and hard, so they were mistaken for its spine until after this Pokémon was successfully restored.

abilities.name: Guarded Grill
abilities.effect: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon takes −100 damage from that attack.

attacks.name: Metallic Turbo
attacks.effect: Take 2 {M} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A2-116.name: Bronzor
A2-116.description: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.

A2-117.name: Bronzong
A2-117.description: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

A2-115.name: Wormadam
A2-115.description: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

A2-120.name: Heatran
A2-120.description: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

attacks.name: Steel Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A2-118.name: Probopass
A2-118.description: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don't come back.

attacks.name: Triple Nose
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads.

A2-123.name: Garchomp
A2-123.description: It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.

abilities.name: Reckless Shearing
abilities.effect: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw a card.

A2-121.name: Gible
A2-121.description: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

A2-124.name: Lickitung
A2-124.description: If this Pokémon's sticky saliva gets on you and you don't clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won't go away, either.

A2-122.name: Gabite
A2-122.description: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.

attacks.name: Licking Fury
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

A2-126.name: Eevee
A2-126.description: Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

A2-127.name: Porygon
A2-127.description: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.

A2-129.name: Porygon-Z
A2-129.description: Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Z's behavior.

attacks.name: Buggy Beam
attacks.effect: Change the type of the next Energy that will be generated for your opponent to 1 of the following at random: {G}, {R}, {W}, {L}, {P}, {F}, {D}, or {M}.

A2-130.name: Aipom
A2-130.description: As it did more and more with its tail, its hands became clumsy. It makes its nest high in the treetops.

A2-128.name: Porygon2
A2-128.description: This is a Porygon that was updated with special data. Porygon2 develops itself by learning about many different subjects all on its own.

A2-131.name: Ambipom
A2-131.description: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that's proof it really likes you.

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

A2-133.name: Staravia
A2-133.description: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.

A2-134.name: Staraptor
A2-134.description: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

A2-132.name: Starly
A2-132.description: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

attacks.name: Pluck
attacks.effect: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A2-135.name: Bidoof
A2-135.description: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.effect: Halve your opponent's Active Pokémon's remaining HP, rounded down.

A2-136.name: Bibarel
A2-136.description: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.

A2-140.name: Purugly
A2-140.description: It would claim another Pokémon's nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.

attacks.name: Interrupt
attacks.effect: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a card you find there and shuffle it into your opponent's deck.

A2-139.name: Glameow
A2-139.description: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

attacks.name: Pose
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A2-142.name: Fan Rotom
A2-142.description: This Rotom has entered an electric fan. It smirks with satisfaction over a prank well pulled after it blows away everything around it.

attacks.name: Spin Storm
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, put your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

A2-144.name: Skull Fossil
A2-144.effect: Play this card as if it were a 40-HP Basic {C} Pokémon. At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play. This card can't retreat.

A2-143.name: Regigigas
A2-143.description: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.

attacks.name: Raging Hammer
attacks.effect: This attack does more damage equal to the damage this Pokémon has on it.

A2-141.name: Chatot
A2-141.description: It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them into thinking it's one of them. This way they won't attack it.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

A2-138.name: Lopunny
A2-138.description: Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings. If danger approaches, this Pokémon responds with superdestructive kicks.

attacks.name: Jump Kick
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A2-137.name: Buneary
A2-137.description: If both of Buneary's ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. It's a sure sign the Pokémon is in need of care.

A2-145.name: Armor Fossil
A2-145.effect: Play this card as if it were a 40-HP Basic {C} Pokémon. At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play. This card can't retreat.

A2-146.name: Pokémon Communication
A2-146.effect: Choose a Pokémon in your hand and switch it with a random Pokémon in your deck.

A2-147.name: Giant Cape
A2-147.effect: The Pokémon this card is attached to gets +20 HP.

A2-148.name: Rocky Helmet
A2-148.effect: If the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, do 20 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

A2-149.name: Lum Berry
A2-149.effect: At the end of each turn, if the Pokémon this card is attached to is affected by any Special Conditions, it recovers from all of them, and discard this card.

A2-151.name: Team Galactic Grunt
A2-151.effect: Put 1 random Glameow, Stunky, or Croagunk from your deck into your hand.

A2-150.name: Cyrus
A2-150.effect: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has damage on it to the Active Spot.

A2-152.name: Cynthia
A2-152.effect: During this turn, attacks used by your Garchomp or Togekiss do +50 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A2-153.name: Volkner
A2-153.effect: Choose 1 of your Electivire or Luxray. Attach 2 {L} Energy from your discard pile to that Pokémon.

A2-158.name: Carnivine
A2-158.description: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

attacks.name: Flog
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

A2-159.name: Shaymin
A2-159.description: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.

abilities.name: Fragrant Flower Garden
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

A2-162.name: Manaphy
A2-162.description: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Oceanic Gift
attacks.effect: Choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, take a {W} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to that Pokémon.

A2-161.name: Gastrodon
A2-161.description: They normally inhabit rocky seashores, but in times of continuous rain, they can sometimes be found in the mountains, far from the sea.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A2-154.name: Dawn
A2-154.effect: Move an Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

A2-156.name: Tangrowth
A2-156.description: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

A2-160.name: Mamoswine
A2-160.description: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −30 damage from attacks from {R} or {W} Pokémon.

A2-155.name: Mars
A2-155.effect: Your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck and draws a card for each of their remaining points needed to win.

A2-157.name: Combee
A2-157.description: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a hundred, packed closely together in a lump.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.effect: Put 1 random Basic Pokémon from your deck onto your Bench.

A2-163.name: Shinx
A2-163.description: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

A2A-001.name: Heracross
A2A-001.description: It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.

attacks.name: Single-Horn Throw
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 70 more damage.

A2A-002.name: Burmy
A2A-002.description:
To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers
itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

A2A-004.name: Combee
A2A-004.description: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a hundred, packed closely together in a lump.

A2A-005.name: Vespiquen
A2A-005.description: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

A2A-006.name: Cherubi
A2A-006.description: It nimbly dashes about to avoid getting pecked by bird Pokémon that would love to make off with its small, nutrient-rich storage ball.

A2A-003.name: Mothim
A2A-003.description: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.

A2A-007.name: Cherrim
A2A-007.description: As a bud, it barely moves. It sits still, placidly waiting for sunlight to appear.

attacks.name: Worry Seed
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

A2A-009.name: Carnivine
A2A-009.description: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

abilities.name: Power Link
abilities.effect: If you have Arceus or Arceus ex in play, attacks used by this Pokémon do +30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

abilities.name: Forest Breath
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may take a {G} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your {G} Pokémon.

A2A-011.name: Houndour
A2A-011.description: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

A2A-016.name: Barboach
A2A-016.description: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its prey's location.

A2A-008.name: Cherrim
A2A-008.description: After absorbing plenty of sunlight, Cherrim takes this form. It's full of energy while it's like this, and its liveliness will go on until sundown.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

A2A-013.name: Heatran
A2A-013.description: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

abilities.name: Speed Link
abilities.effect: If you have Arceus or Arceus ex in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Ragin' Mad Strike
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

A2A-014.name: Marill
A2A-014.description: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry even when it plays in the water.

A2A-012.name: Houndoom
A2A-012.description: If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

A2A-017.name: Whiscash
A2A-017.description: It is extremely protective of its territory. If any foe approaches, it attacks using vicious tremors.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A2A-018.name: Snorunt
A2A-018.description: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.

A2A-015.name: Azumarill
A2A-015.description: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.

A2A-019.name: Froslass
A2A-019.description: When it finds humans or Pokémon it likes, it freezes them and takes them to its chilly den, where they become decorations.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.effect: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A2A-020.name: Snover
A2A-020.description: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.

A2A-021.name: Abomasnow
A2A-021.description: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

abilities.name: Vigor Link

abilities.name: Snowy Terrain

A2A-023.name: Origin Forme Palkia
A2A-023.description: It soars across the sky in a form that greatly resembles the creator of all things. Perhaps this imitation of appearance is Palkia's strategy for gaining Arceus's powers.

attacks.name: Zone Smash
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

A2A-024.name: Phione
A2A-024.description: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

A2A-025.name: Pikachu
A2A-025.description: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.effect: This attack also does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A2A-028.name: Manectric
A2A-028.description: It stimulates its own muscles with electricity, so it can move quickly. It eases its soreness with electricity, too, so it can recover quickly as well.

attacks.name: Flash
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

A2A-027.name: Electrike
A2A-027.description: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

A2A-026.name: Raichu
A2A-026.description: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

abilities.name: Resilience Link
abilities.effect: If you have Arceus or Arceus ex in play, this Pokémon takes −30 damage from attacks.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A2A-031.name: Gastly
A2A-031.description: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent reveals a random card from their hand and shuffles it into their deck.

A2A-030.name: Clefable
A2A-030.description: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.

attacks.name: Moonblast
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do −30 damage.

A2A-029.name: Clefairy
A2A-029.description: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

A2A-032.name: Haunter
A2A-032.description: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

A2A-033.name: Gengar
A2A-033.description: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

A2A-034.name: Unown
A2A-034.description: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.

abilities.name: CHECK
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may choose either player. Look at the top card of that player's deck.

A2A-035.name: Rotom
A2A-035.description: Its electricity-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.

abilities.name: Speed Link
abilities.effect: If you have Arceus or Arceus ex in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Dash Attack
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A2A-037.name: Phanpy
A2A-037.description: This Pokémon lives and nests on a riverbank. After playing in the mud, it won't be able to settle down unless it washes its body.

A2A-036.name: Sudowoodo
A2A-036.description: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.

attacks.name: Fighting Headbutt
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon {ex}, this attack does 30 more damage.

A2A-039.name: Larvitar
A2A-039.description: Born deep underground, this Pokémon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.

A2A-038.name: Donphan
A2A-038.description: Donphan is covered in tough hide, so even being hit by a car won't faze this Pokémon. However, it is extremely susceptible to rain.

attacks.name: Rolling Spin
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Rolling Spin attack does +60 damage.

A2A-041.name: Tyranitar
A2A-041.description: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It is so insolent that it doesn't care about others.

abilities.name: Power Link
abilities.effect: If you have Arceus or Arceus ex in play, attacks used by this Pokémon do +30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A2A-040.name: Pupitar
A2A-040.description: Its shell is as hard as bedrock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

A2A-042.name: Nosepass
A2A-042.description: It moves less than an inch a year, but when it's in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.

A2A-043.name: Meditite
A2A-043.description: It never skips its daily yoga training. It heightens its inner strength through meditation.

A2A-044.name: Medicham
A2A-044.description: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's next move.

attacks.name: Kick Shot
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A2A-045.name: Gible
A2A-045.description: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.effect: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A2A-046.name: Gabite
A2A-046.description: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.

A2A-051.name: Croagunk
A2A-051.description: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

A2A-050.name: Crobat
A2A-050.description: Both of its legs have turned into wings. Without a sound, Crobat flies swiftly toward its prey and sinks its fangs into the nape of its target's neck.

abilities.name: Cunning Link
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if you have Arceus or Arceus ex in play, you may do 30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A2A-048.description: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.

A2A-049.name: Golbat
A2A-049.description: It loves to drink other creatures' blood. It's said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it's gathered.

A2A-053.name: Magnemite
A2A-053.description: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

A2A-054.name: Magneton
A2A-054.description: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

A2A-052.description: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.

attacks.name: Iron Beam Breaker

A2A-058.name: Bronzor
A2A-058.description: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.

A2A-063.name: Snorlax
A2A-063.description: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.effect: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

A2A-064.description: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.

A2A-061.name: Giratina
A2A-061.description: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.

attacks.name: Crisis Dive
attacks.effect: Discard 2 random Energy from this Pokémon.

A2A-065.name: Noctowl
A2A-065.description: Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.

attacks.name: Silent Wing
attacks.effect: Your opponent reveals their hand.

A2A-066.name: Starly
A2A-066.description: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

A2A-067.name: Staravia
A2A-067.description: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.

A2A-069.name: Shaymin
A2A-069.description: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.

A2A-068.description: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

A2A-070.description: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.

A2B-001.name: Weedle
A2B-001.description: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.effect: Put 1 random Weedle from your deck onto your Bench.

A2B-002.description: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

A2B-004.name: Pinsir
A2B-004.description: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.

attacks.name: Guillotine Rush
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

A2B-005.name: Sprigatito
A2B-005.description: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
