attacks.name: Crushing Spear
attacks.effect: Discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A2B-006.name: Floragato
A2B-006.description: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.

A2B-007.name: Meowscarada
A2B-007.description: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.

attacks.name: Fighting Claws
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex, this attack does 70 more damage.

A2B-008.name: Charmander
A2B-008.description: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

A2B-009.name: Charmeleon
A2B-009.description: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.effect: Take 3 {R} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

A2B-012.name: Magmortar
A2B-012.description: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Smoke Bomb
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

A2B-013.name: Paldean Tauros
A2B-013.description: When heated by fire energy, its horns can get hotter than 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Those gored by them will suffer both wounds and burns.

attacks.name: Blaze Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

A2B-011.name: Magmar
A2B-011.description: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.

A2B-014.name: Tentacool
A2B-014.description: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.

A2B-015.name: Tentacruel
A2B-015.description: When the red orbs on Tentacruel's head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.

A2B-016.name: Buizel
A2B-016.description: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.

A2B-017.name: Floatzel
A2B-017.description: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A2B-018.name: Wiglett
A2B-018.description: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

attacks.name: Spring Out
attacks.effect: 1 of your opponent's Pokémon is chosen at random. Do 30 damage to it.

attacks.name: Pop Out Throughout
attacks.effect: 1 of your opponent's Pokémon is chosen at random 3 times. For each time a Pokémon was chosen, do 50 damage to it.

A2B-020.name: Dondozo
A2B-020.description: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it's bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.

attacks.name: Ocean Cyclone
attacks.effect: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A2B-021.name: Tatsugiri
A2B-021.description: This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.

abilities.name: Retreat Directive
abilities.effect: Your Active Dondozo has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.effect: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

A2B-023.name: Voltorb
A2B-023.description: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

A2B-025.name: Pachirisu
A2B-025.description: It's one of the kinds of Pokémon with electric cheek pouches. It shoots charges from its tail.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched  Pokémon.

A2B-026.name: Pawmi
A2B-026.description: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.

A2B-024.name: Electrode
A2B-024.description: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

A2B-027.name: Pawmo
A2B-027.description: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.

A2B-028.name: Pawmot
A2B-028.description: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, do 20 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

A2B-030.name: Kadabra
A2B-030.description: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.

A2B-029.name: Abra
A2B-029.description: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra's dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.

A2B-031.name: Alakazam
A2B-031.description: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.

attacks.name: Psychic Suppression
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any Energy attached.

A2B-032.name: Mr. Mime
A2B-032.description: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.

attacks.name: Juggling
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Broken-Space Bellow
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may take a {P} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Chaotic Impact
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A2B-033.name: Drifloon
A2B-033.description: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.

A2B-037.name: Machop
A2B-037.description: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

A2B-036.name: Gimmighoul
A2B-036.description: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.

attacks.name: Chest-ouflage
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

A2B-034.name: Drifblim
A2B-034.description: It can generate and release gas within its body. That's how it can control the altitude of its drift.

A2B-038.name: Machoke
A2B-038.description: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

attacks.name: Pummel
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

A2B-039.name: Machamp
A2B-039.description: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

attacks.name: Power Press
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {F} Energy attached, this attack does 50 more damage.

A2B-040.name: Hitmonlee
A2B-040.description: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.

A2B-042.name: Riolu
A2B-042.description: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.

A2B-041.name: Hitmonchan
A2B-041.description: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.

A2B-045.name: Ekans
A2B-045.description: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.

attacks.name: Aura Sphere
attacks.effect: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A2B-044.name: Flamigo
A2B-044.description: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

A2B-049.name: Spiritomb
A2B-049.description: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 60 more damage.

A2B-052.name: Tinkatink
A2B-052.description: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.

A2B-053.name: Tinkatuff
A2B-053.description: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.

attacks.name: Tenacious Hammer
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

A2B-051.name: Grafaiai
A2B-051.description: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.

abilities.name: Poison Coating
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A2B-047.name: Paldean Wooper
A2B-047.description: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A2B-050.name: Shroodle
A2B-050.description: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.

A2B-056.name: Revavroom
A2B-056.description: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders— now numbering eight—to generate energy.

attacks.name: Spinning Drift
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

A2B-057.name: Gholdengo
A2B-057.description: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.

attacks.name: Scintillating Surfing
attacks.effect: Flip a coin for each {M} Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

A2B-046.name: Arbok
A2B-046.description: After stunning its opponents with the pattern on its stomach, it quickly wraps them up in its body and waits for them to stop moving.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A2B-058.name: Rattata
A2B-058.description: Its incisors grow continuously throughout its life. If its incisors get too long, this Pokémon becomes unable to eat, and it starves to death.

A2B-055.name: Varoom
A2B-055.description: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

attacks.name: Terrific Thumping
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 more damage.

A2B-061.name: Wigglytuff
A2B-061.description: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.

abilities.name: Comforting Song
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon.

A2B-060.name: Jigglypuff
A2B-060.description: It hugely inflates its stomach and sings a mysterious melody. If you hear this melody, you'll become sleepy right away.

A2B-059.name: Raticate
A2B-059.description: People say that it fled from its enemies by using its small webbed hind feet to swim from island to island in Alola.

A2B-062.name: Lickitung
A2B-062.description: If this Pokémon's sticky saliva gets on you and you don't clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won't go away, either.

A2B-064.name: Bidoof
A2B-064.description: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

A2B-063.name: Lickilicky
A2B-063.description: Lickilicky's strange tongue can stretch to many times the length of its body. No one has figured out how Lickilicky's tongue can stretch so far.

attacks.name: Carefree Press
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

A2B-066.name: Buneary
A2B-066.description: If both of Buneary's ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. It's a sure sign the Pokémon is in need of care.

A2B-067.name: Lopunny
A2B-067.description: Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings. If danger approaches, this Pokémon responds with superdestructive kicks.

A2B-068.name: Cyclizar
A2B-068.description: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.

attacks.name: Overacceleration
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Overacceleration attack does +20 damage.

A2B-071.name: Red
A2B-071.effect: During this turn, attacks used by your Pokémon do +20 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon ex.

A2B-070.name: Pokémon Center Lady
A2B-070.effect: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon, and it recovers from all Special Conditions.

A2B-069.name: Iono
A2B-069.effect: Each player shuffles the cards in their hand into their deck, then draws that many cards.

A2B-074.name: Buizel
A2B-074.description: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.

A2B-072.name: Team Rocket Grunt
A2B-072.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A2B-073.name: Meowscarada
A2B-073.description: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.

attacks.name: Fighting Claws
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex, this attack does 70 more damage.

A2B-075.name: Tatsugiri
A2B-075.description: This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.

A2B-097.name: Weedle
A2B-097.description: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.effect: Put 1 random Weedle from your deck onto your Bench.

A2B-099.name: Charmander
A2B-099.description: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

A2B-098.name: Kakuna
A2B-098.description: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

A2B-100.name: Charmeleon
A2B-100.description: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

A2B-101.name: Wiglett
A2B-101.description: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

attacks.effect: 1 of your opponent's Pokémon is chosen at random. Do 30 damage to it.

A2B-102.description: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it's bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.

A2B-104.name: Riolu
A2B-104.description: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.

A2B-105.name: Varoom
A2B-105.description: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

A2B-106.name: Revavroom
