A2B-111.name: Poké Ball
A2B-111.effect: Put a random Basic Pokémon from your deck into your hand.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.effect: Take 3 {R} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

A3-001.name: Exeggcute
A3-001.description: Though it may look like it's just a bunch of eggs, it's a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

A3-002.name: Alolan Exeggutor
A3-002.description: Blazing sunlight has brought out the true form and powers of this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tropical Hammer
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A3-004.name: Masquerain
A3-004.description: It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any direction—to and fro and sideways.

A3-005.name: Maractus
A3-005.description: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.

A3-008.name: Trevenant
A3-008.description: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it's kind.

A3-006.name: Karrablast
A3-006.description: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.

A3-009.name: Rowlet
A3-009.description: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.

A3-003.name: Surskit
A3-003.description: They usually live on ponds, but after an evening shower, they may appear on puddles in towns.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

A3-011.name: Dartrix
A3-011.description: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don't groom it diligently, it may stop listening to you.

A3-010.name: Rowlet
A3-010.description: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.effect: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pierce the Pain
attacks.effect: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that have damage on them.

A3-013.name: Grubbin
A3-013.description: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.

A3-014.name: Fomantis
A3-014.description: Fomantis hates having its naps interrupted. It fires off beams using energy it gathers by bathing in the sun.

A3-016.name: Morelull
A3-016.description: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull's head. The caps regrow overnight.

A3-017.name: Shiinotic
A3-017.description: Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

attacks.name: Flickering Light
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

A3-018.name: Bounsweet
A3-018.description: Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled-down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.

A3-020.name: Tsareena
A3-020.description: This Pokémon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.

attacks.name: Three Kick Combo
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

A3-021.name: Wimpod
A3-021.description: It's nature's cleaner—it eats anything and everything,  including garbage and rotten things. The ground near  its nest is always clean.

abilities.name: Wimp Out
abilities.effect: During your first turn, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

A3-022.name: Golisopod
A3-022.description: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

A3-024.name: Tapu Bulu
A3-024.description: Although it's called a guardian deity, it's violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.

attacks.name: Stuck-In Tackle
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A3-025.name: Growlithe
A3-025.description: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

A3-027.name: Alolan Marowak
A3-027.description: This Pokémon sets the bone it holds on fire and dances through the night as a way to mourn its fallen allies.

attacks.name: Burning Bonemerang
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads. If at least 1 of them is heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

A3-026.name: Arcanine
A3-026.description: An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.

attacks.name: Anchor Shot
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

A3-028.name: Fletchinder
A3-028.description: Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.

A3-030.name: Litten
A3-030.description: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

A3-007.name: Phantump
A3-007.description: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit's rebirth as this Pokémon.

A3-015.name: Lurantis
A3-015.description: By masquerading as a bug Pokémon, it lowers the guard of actual bug Pokémon lured in by a scent of sweet flowers. Its sickles bring them down.

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

A3-019.name: Steenee
A3-019.description: Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

A3-029.name: Talonflame
A3-029.description: It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.

A3-031.name: Litten
A3-031.description: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

A3-035.name: Salandit
A3-035.description: It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.

A3-032.name: Torracat
A3-032.description: Torracat will let its Trainer coddle it once they've grown close, but it's a powerful, sharp-clawed Pokémon, so its Trainer gets covered in scratches.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

A3-034.name: Oricorio
A3-034.description: This form of Oricorio has sipped red nectar. It whips up blazing flames as it moves to the steps of its passionate dance.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.effect: Discard a random Energy from both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Scar-Charged Smash
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

A3-036.name: Salazzle
A3-036.description: Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.

attacks.name: Heated Poison
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned and Burned.

A3-038.name: Alolan Sandshrew
A3-038.description: Life on mountains covered with deep snow has granted this Pokémon a body of ice that's as hard as steel.

A3-039.name: Alolan Sandslash
A3-039.description: It uses large, hooked claws to cut a path through deep snow as it runs. On snowy mountains, this Sandslash is faster than any other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spike Armor
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack, do 40 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

A3-037.name: Turtonator
A3-037.description: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.effect: Discard a {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

A3-040.name: Alolan Vulpix
A3-040.description: After long years in the ever-snowcapped mountains of Alola, this Vulpix has gained power over ice.

attacks.name: Call Forth Cold
attacks.effect: Take a {W} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

A3-042.name: Shellder
A3-042.description: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.

A3-044.name: Lapras
A3-044.description: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

A3-043.name: Cloyster
A3-043.description: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

A3-046.name: Popplio
A3-046.description: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.

A3-045.name: Popplio
A3-045.description: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

A3-050.name: Wishiwashi
A3-050.description: Individually, they're incredibly weak. It's by gathering up into schools that they're able to confront opponents.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.effect: Put 1 random Wishiwashi or Wishiwashi ex from your deck onto your Bench.

A3-047.name: Brionne
A3-047.description: It gets excited when it sees a dance it doesn't know. This hard worker practices diligently until it can learn that dance.

A3-041.name: Alolan Ninetales
A3-041.description: A deity resides in the snowy mountains where this Pokémon lives. In ancient times, it was worshiped as that deity's incarnation.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: School Storm
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 more damage for each of your Benched Wishiwashi and Wishiwashi ex.

attacks.name: Insatiable Striking
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Insatiable Striking attack does +40 damage.

A3-054.name: Pyukumuku
A3-054.description: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.

abilities.name: Innards Out
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, do 50 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

A3-048.name: Primarina
A3-048.description: To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.

abilities.name: Melodious Healing
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may heal 30 damage from each of your {W} Pokémon.

A3-055.name: Bruxish
A3-055.description: It grinds its teeth with great force to stimulate its brain. It fires the psychic energy created by this process from the protuberance on its head.

A3-052.name: Dewpider
A3-052.description: It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.

A3-056.name: Tapu Fini
A3-056.description: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

A3-057.name: Pikachu
A3-057.description: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A3-059.name: Alolan Geodude
A3-059.description: If you mistake it for a rock and step on it, it will headbutt you in anger. In addition to the pain, it will also zap you with a shock.

A3-061.name: Alolan Golem
A3-061.description: It's grumpy and stubborn. If you upset it, it discharges electricity from the surface of its body and growls with a voice like thunder.

attacks.name: Super Zap Cannon
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {L} Energy from this Pokémon.

A3-060.name: Alolan Graveler
A3-060.description:
When two Graveler fight each other, it fills the
surroundings with flashes of light and sound.
People call it the “fireworks of the earth.”

A3-066.name: Oricorio
A3-066.description: This form of Oricorio has sipped yellow nectar. It uses nimble steps to approach opponents, then knocks them out with electric punches.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.effect: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon ex.

A3-064.name: Charjabug
A3-064.description: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.

A3-068.name: Tapu Koko
A3-068.description: Although it's called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

attacks.name: Volt Switch
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched {L} Pokémon.

A3-073.name: Lunatone
A3-073.description: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It's active on the night of a full moon.

A3-074.name: Shuppet
A3-074.description: It loves to feed on feelings like envy and malice. Its upright horn catches the emotions of people.

A3-069.name: Mr. Mime
A3-069.description: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.

attacks.name: Barrier Shove
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

A3-067.name: Togedemaru
A3-067.description: With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.

attacks.name: Electrosmash
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

A3-065.name: Vikavolt
A3-065.description: It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.

attacks.name: Disconnect
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.

A3-072.name: Grumpig
A3-072.description: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.

A3-070.name: Sableye
A3-070.description: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

A3-077.name: Oricorio
A3-077.description: This form of Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. It uses ethereal dance steps to call forth the spirits of the dead.

attacks.name: Spiteful Dance
attacks.effect: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

A3-071.name: Spoink
A3-071.description: Spoink will die if it stops bouncing. The pearl on its head amplifies its psychic powers.

attacks.name: Psycharge
attacks.effect: Take a {P} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

A3-076.name: Oricorio
A3-076.description: This form of Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. It elevates its mind with the gentle steps of its dance, then unleashes its psychic energy.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

A3-063.name: Heliolisk
A3-063.description: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

A3-053.name: Araquanid
A3-053.description: It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.

attacks.name: Dangerous Claws
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

A3-075.name: Banette
A3-075.description: This Pokémon developed from an abandoned doll that amassed a grudge. It is seen in dark alleys.

attacks.name: Night Bind
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, they can't take any Energy from their Energy Zone to attach to their Active Pokémon.

A3-062.name: Helioptile
A3-062.description: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon's electric moves.

A3-078.name: Cutiefly
A3-078.description: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. In fields of flowers, it gets into skirmishes with Butterfree over food.

A3-085.name: Cosmog
A3-085.description: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A3-082.name: Palossand
A3-082.description: The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokémon into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped, it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.

A3-089.name: Cubone
A3-089.description: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.

A3-080.name: Comfey
A3-080.description: Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won't wither once they're attached to a Comfey.

abilities.name: Flower Shield
abilities.effect: Each of your Pokémon that has any {P} Energy attached recovers from all Special Conditions and can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

A3-081.name: Sandygast
A3-081.description: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else—like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.

A3-088.name: Necrozma
A3-088.description: It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It's apparently from another world.

attacks.name: Prismatic Laser
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

abilities.name: Psychic Connect
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may move all {P} Energy from 1 of your Benched {P} Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

A3-083.name: Mimikyu
A3-083.description: There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyu's old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.

attacks.name: Shadow Hit
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your Pokémon.

A3-079.name: Ribombee
A3-079.description: It makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar. The puffs' effects depend on the type of ingredients and how much of each one is used.

A3-084.name: Tapu Lele
A3-084.description: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.

attacks.name: Energy Arrow
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Energy attached to that Pokémon.

A3-090.name: Makuhita
A3-090.description: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pokémon that can withstand any attack.

A3-093.name: Drilbur
A3-093.description: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.

A3-092.name: Solrock
A3-092.description: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.

A3-094.name: Timburr
A3-094.description: It loves helping out with construction projects. It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt, it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.

A3-095.name: Gurdurr
A3-095.description: It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.

A3-097.name: Crabrawler
A3-097.description: This Pokémon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.

A3-098.name: Rockruff
A3-098.description: This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.effect: Put a random card that evolves from Rockruff from your deck into your hand.

A3-099.name: Rockruff
A3-099.description: This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

A3-102.name: Mudbray
A3-102.description: This Pokémon covers itself in mud that it has regurgitated. The mud won't dry out even if it's exposed to the sun for a long time.

A3-103.name: Mudsdale
A3-103.description: This Pokémon has been treasured not just for its physical labor but also because it produces high-quality mud used for making pottery.

attacks.name: High Horsepower
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 40 damage to itself.

A3-091.name: Hariyama
A3-091.description: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.

attacks.name: Push Out
attacks.effect: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

A3-086.name: Cosmoem
A3-086.description:
The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it
the “cocoon of the stars” and built an altar to worship it.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −50 damage from attacks.

A3-101.name: Lycanroc
A3-101.description: This Pokémon uses its rocky mane to slash any who approach. It will even disobey its Trainer if it dislikes the orders it was given.

attacks.name: Blood Fang
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has more remaining HP than this Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

abilities.name: Offload Pass
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, move all {F} Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A3-096.name: Conkeldurr
A3-096.description: Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

A3-100.name: Lycanroc
A3-100.description: Lycanroc attacks its prey with its sharp claws and fangs. It loyally obeys the instructions of a Trainer it trusts.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A3-105.name: Minior
A3-105.description: Places where Minior fall from the night sky are few and far between, with Alola being one of the precious few.

attacks.name: Star Drop
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A3-106.name: Alolan Rattata
A3-106.description: It shows no interest in anything that isn't fresh. If you take it shopping with you, it will help you pick out ingredients.

A3-107.name: Alolan Raticate
A3-107.description: It has an incredibly greedy personality. Its nest is filled with so much food gathered by Rattata at its direction, it can't possibly eat it all.

attacks.name: Scrounge-and-Scarf
attacks.effect: Discard a random Item card from your opponent's hand.

A3-108.name: Alolan Meowth
A3-108.description: It's accustomed to luxury because it used to live with Alolan royalty. As a result, it's very picky about food.

A3-109.name: Alolan Persian
A3-109.description: The round face of Alolan Persian is considered to be a symbol of prosperity in the Alola region, so these Pokémon are very well cared for.

abilities.name: Fur Coat
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

A3-110.name: Alolan Grimer
A3-110.description: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.

attacks.name: Chemical Panic
attacks.effect: 1 Special Condition from among Asleep, Burned, Confused, Paralyzed, and Poisoned is chosen at random, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition. Any Special Conditions already affecting that Pokémon will not be chosen.

A3-112.name: Absol
A3-112.description: Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and mountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely sensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.

attacks.name: Unseen Claw
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

A3-113.name: Trubbish
A3-113.description: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

A3-114.name: Garbodor
A3-114.description: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A3-115.name: Mareanie
A3-115.description: This Pokémon wanders the seaside looking for food. It often gets electric shocks from broken Pincurchin spines that it tries to eat.

A3-119.name: Excadrill
A3-119.description: It's not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill's rampant digging.

A3-117.name: Alolan Diglett
A3-117.description: The metal-rich geology of this Pokémon's habitat caused it to develop steel whiskers on its head.

A3-118.name: Alolan Dugtrio
A3-118.description: Their beautiful, metallic whiskers create a sort of protective helmet on their heads, and they also function as highly precise sensors.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

A3-116.name: Toxapex
A3-116.description: This Pokémon lives within a dome made by its own legs. Toxapex monitors its surroundings by sensing the flow of the tide through its spikes.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

A3-120.name: Escavalier
A3-120.description: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.

attacks.name: Pike
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A3-121.name: Klefki
A3-121.description: Once it absorbs a key's metal ions, it discards the key without a second thought. However, it will hang on to keys it favors for decades.

attacks.name: Unlock
attacks.effect: Draw a card.

abilities.name: Rising Road
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Breaker
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

A3-123.name: Magearna
A3-123.description: It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.

attacks.name: Silver Cannon
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has an Ability, this attack does 40 more damage.

A3-124.name: Drampa
A3-124.description: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.

attacks.name: Berserk
attacks.effect: If any of your Benched Pokémon have damage on them, this attack does 50 more damage.

A3-125.name: Jangmo-o
A3-125.description: They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.

A3-126.name: Hakamo-o
A3-126.description: The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.

A3-127.name: Kommo-o
A3-127.description: It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.

attacks.name: Clanging Scales
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes +30 damage from attacks.

A3-128.name: Tauros
A3-128.description: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it's a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

A3-130.name: Delcatty
A3-130.description: It dislikes dirty places. It often searches for a comfortable place in which to groom itself.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.effect: Take a {C} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A3-129.name: Skitty
A3-129.description: It can't stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.

A3-131.name: Fletchling
A3-131.description: This Pokémon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.

A3-132.name: Hawlucha
A3-132.description: Its elegant finishing moves—performed by nimbly leaping around using its wings—are polished in the forest where it was born and raised.

attacks.name: Justified Press
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a {D} Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

A3-133.name: Pikipek
A3-133.description: It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.

A3-134.name: Trumbeak
A3-134.description: It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.

A3-135.name: Toucannon
A3-135.description: They smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate. The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.

A3-136.name: Yungoos
A3-136.description: Its stomach fills most of its torso. It wanders the same path every day, searching for fresh food.

A3-137.name: Gumshoos
A3-137.description: Once it finds signs of prey, it will patiently stake out the location, waiting until the sun goes down.

A3-138.name: Stufful
A3-138.description: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.

A3-140.name: Oranguru
A3-140.description: People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokémon of the forest.

attacks.name: Primate's Trap
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon cost 1 {C} more, and its Retreat Cost is 1 {C} more.

A3-141.name: Komala
A3-141.description: Komala spends its entire life sleeping. It feeds on leaves that contain a potent poison only Komala can break down.

abilities.name: Comatose
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, whenever you attach an Energy from your Energy Zone to it, it is now Asleep.

A3-139.name: Bewear
A3-139.description: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.effect: This Pokémon is now Confused.

A3-142.name: Big Malasada
A3-142.effect: Heal 10 damage and remove a random Special Condition from your Active Pokémon.

A3-143.name: Fishing Net
A3-143.effect: Put a random Basic {W} Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

A3-144.name: Rare Candy
A3-144.effect: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it, skipping the Stage 1. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.

A3-145.name: Rotom Dex
A3-145.effect: Look at the top card of your deck. Then, you may shuffle your deck.

A3-146.name: Poison Barb
A3-146.effect: If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A3-147.name: Leaf Cape
A3-147.effect: The {G} Pokémon this card is attached to gets +30 HP.

A3-148.name: Acerola
A3-148.effect: Choose 1 of your Palossand or Mimikyu that has damage on it, and move 40 of its damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A3-149.name: Ilima
A3-149.effect: Put 1 of your {C} Pokémon that has damage on it into your hand.

A3-150.name: Kiawe
A3-150.effect: Choose 1 of your Alolan Marowak or Turtonator. Take 2 {R} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to that Pokémon. Your turn ends.

A3-151.name: Guzma
A3-151.effect: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

A3-152.name: Lana
A3-152.effect: You can use this card only if you have Araquanid in play. Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

A3-154.name: Mallow
A3-154.effect: Heal all damage from 1 of your Shiinotic or Tsareena. If you do, discard all Energy from that Pokémon.

A3-153.name: Sophocles
A3-153.effect: During this turn, attacks used by your Alolan Golem, Vikavolt, or Togedemaru do +30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A3-155.name: Lillie
A3-155.effect: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Stage 2 Pokémon.

A3-156.name: Alolan Exeggutor
A3-156.description: Blazing sunlight has brought out the true form and powers of this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tropical Hammer
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A3-158.name: Tsareena
A3-158.description: This Pokémon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.

attacks.name: Three Kick Combo
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

A3-159.name: Tapu Bulu
A3-159.description: Although it's called a guardian deity, it's violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.

attacks.name: Stuck-In Tackle
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A3-157.name: Morelull
A3-157.description: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull's head. The caps regrow overnight.

A3-160.name: Alolan Marowak
A3-160.description: This Pokémon sets the bone it holds on fire and dances through the night as a way to mourn its fallen allies.

attacks.name: Burning Bonemerang
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads. If at least 1 of them is heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

A3-161.name: Turtonator
A3-161.description: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.effect: Discard a {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

A3-162.name: Alolan Vulpix
A3-162.description: After long years in the ever-snowcapped mountains of Alola, this Vulpix has gained power over ice.

attacks.name: Call Forth Cold
attacks.effect: Take a {W} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

A3-163.name: Pyukumuku
A3-163.description: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.

abilities.name: Innards Out
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, do 50 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

A3-164.name: Tapu Fini
A3-164.description: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

A3-165.name: Oricorio
A3-165.description: This form of Oricorio has sipped yellow nectar. It uses nimble steps to approach opponents, then knocks them out with electric punches.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.effect: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon ex.

A3-166.name: Tapu Koko
A3-166.description: Although it's called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

attacks.name: Volt Switch
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched {L} Pokémon.

A3-167.name: Cutiefly
A3-167.description: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. In fields of flowers, it gets into skirmishes with Butterfree over food.

A3-168.name: Comfey
A3-168.description: Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won't wither once they're attached to a Comfey.

abilities.name: Flower Shield
abilities.effect: Each of your Pokémon that has any {P} Energy attached recovers from all Special Conditions and can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

A3-169.name: Sandygast
A3-169.description: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else—like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.

A3-170.name: Tapu Lele
A3-170.description: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.

attacks.name: Energy Arrow
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Energy attached to that Pokémon.

A3-171.name: Cosmog
A3-171.description: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A3-172.name: Rockruff
A3-172.description: This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.effect: Put a random card that evolves from Rockruff from your deck into your hand.

A3-173.name: Mudsdale
A3-173.description: This Pokémon has been treasured not just for its physical labor but also because it produces high-quality mud used for making pottery.

attacks.name: High Horsepower
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 40 damage to itself.

A3-174.name: Minior
A3-174.description: Places where Minior fall from the night sky are few and far between, with Alola being one of the precious few.

attacks.name: Star Drop
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A3-175.name: Magearna
A3-175.description: It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.

attacks.name: Silver Cannon
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has an Ability, this attack does 40 more damage.

A3-177.name: Pikipek
A3-177.description: It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.

A3-176.name: Drampa
A3-176.description: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.

attacks.name: Berserk
attacks.effect: If any of your Benched Pokémon have damage on them, this attack does 50 more damage.

A3-179.name: Komala
A3-179.description: Komala spends its entire life sleeping. It feeds on leaves that contain a potent poison only Komala can break down.

abilities.name: Comatose
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, whenever you attach an Energy from your Energy Zone to it, it is now Asleep.

A3-178.name: Bewear
A3-178.description: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.effect: This Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Pierce the Pain
attacks.effect: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that have damage on them.

attacks.name: School Storm
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 more damage for each of your Benched Wishiwashi and Wishiwashi ex.

attacks.name: Anchor Shot
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Insatiable Striking
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Insatiable Striking attack does +40 damage.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Scar-Charged Smash
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

abilities.name: Offload Pass
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, move all {F} Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Psychic Connect
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may move all {P} Energy from 1 of your Benched {P} Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chemical Panic
attacks.effect: 1 Special Condition from among Asleep, Burned, Confused, Paralyzed, and Poisoned is chosen at random, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition. Any Special Conditions already affecting that Pokémon will not be chosen.

abilities.name: Rising Road
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Breaker
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

A3-190.name: Acerola
A3-190.effect: Choose 1 of your Palossand or Mimikyu that has damage on it, and move 40 of its damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A3-192.name: Kiawe
A3-192.effect: Choose 1 of your Alolan Marowak or Turtonator. Take 2 {R} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to that Pokémon. Your turn ends.

A3-191.name: Ilima
A3-191.effect: Put 1 of your {C} Pokémon that has damage on it into your hand.

A3-193.name: Guzma
A3-193.effect: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

A3-194.name: Lana
A3-194.effect: You can use this card only if you have Araquanid in play. Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

A3-196.name: Mallow
A3-196.effect: Heal all damage from 1 of your Shiinotic or Tsareena. If you do, discard all Energy from that Pokémon.

A3-195.name: Sophocles
A3-195.effect: During this turn, attacks used by your Alolan Golem, Vikavolt, or Togedemaru do +30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A3-197.name: Lillie
A3-197.effect: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Stage 2 Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Scar-Charged Smash
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Anchor Shot
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Pierce the Pain
attacks.effect: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that have damage on them.

attacks.name: School Storm
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 more damage for each of your Benched Wishiwashi and Wishiwashi ex.

attacks.name: Insatiable Striking
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Insatiable Striking attack does +40 damage.

abilities.name: Psychic Connect
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may move all {P} Energy from 1 of your Benched {P} Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

abilities.name: Offload Pass
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, move all {F} Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chemical Panic
attacks.effect: 1 Special Condition from among Asleep, Burned, Confused, Paralyzed, and Poisoned is chosen at random, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition. Any Special Conditions already affecting that Pokémon will not be chosen.

A3-210.name: Bulbasaur
A3-210.description: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.

A3-208.name: Guzma
A3-208.effect: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

abilities.name: Rising Road
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Breaker
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

A3-209.name: Lillie
A3-209.effect: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Stage 2 Pokémon.

A3-211.name: Ivysaur
A3-211.description: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

A3-212.name: Venusaur
A3-212.description: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

A3-213.name: Exeggcute
A3-213.description: Though it may look like it's just a bunch of eggs, it's a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

A3-215.name: Squirtle
A3-215.description: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.

A3-214.name: Exeggutor
A3-214.description: Each of Exeggutor's three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don't seem to be very interested in one another.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A3-216.name: Wartortle
A3-216.description: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.

A3-218.name: Staryu
A3-218.description: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you'll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.

A3-219.name: Starmie
A3-219.description: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.

A3-217.name: Blastoise
A3-217.description: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

A3-220.name: Gastly
A3-220.description: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent reveals a random card from their hand and shuffles it into their deck.

A3-221.name: Haunter
A3-221.description: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

A3-222.name: Gengar
A3-222.description: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.

attacks.name: Bother
attacks.effect: Your opponent can't use any Supporter cards from their hand during their next turn.

A3-223.name: Machop
A3-223.description: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

A3-224.name: Machoke
A3-224.description: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

A3-225.name: Machamp
A3-225.description: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

attacks.name: Power Press
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {F} Energy attached, this attack does 50 more damage.

A3-226.name: Cubone
A3-226.description: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do −20 damage.

A3-227.name: Marowak
A3-227.description: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.

A3-228.name: Jigglypuff
A3-228.description: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

A3-229.name: Wigglytuff
A3-229.description: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.

abilities.name: Comforting Song
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Bazooka
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Tropical Swing
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

abilities.name: Shadowy Spellbind
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't use any Supporter cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Sleepy Song
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Psychic Connect
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may move all {P} Energy from 1 of your Benched {P} Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

abilities.name: Rising Road
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Breaker
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

A3A-003.name: Rowlet
A3A-003.description:
It sends its feathers, which are as sharp
as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong,
so its kicks are also formidable.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

A3A-005.name: Decidueye
A3A-005.description:
It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at
opponents. When it simply can't afford to miss,
it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.

attacks.name: Sniping Arrow
attacks.effect: This attack does 70 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A3A-001.name: Petilil
A3A-001.description:
The leaves on its head grow right back even if
they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those
who eat them.

A3A-002.name: Lilligant
A3A-002.description:
The fragrance of the garland on its head has
a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very
difficult.

A3A-004.name: Dartrix
A3A-004.description:
This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you
don't groom it diligently, it may stop listening to you.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Beat
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Big Beat.

A3A-007.name: Pheromosa
A3A-007.description:
A life-form that lives in another world, its body
is thin and supple, but it also possesses
great power.

attacks.name: Jump Blues
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A3A-008.name: Kartana
A3A-008.description:
This Ultra Beast's body, which is as thin
as paper, is like a sharpened sword.

A3A-009.name: Blacephalon
A3A-009.description:
It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the
explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

attacks.name: Beat Punk
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 70 damage to itself.

A3A-014.name: Luxio
A3A-014.description:
Strong electricity courses through the tips of
its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting
in foes.

A3A-012.name: Sharpedo
A3A-012.description:
As soon as it catches the scent of prey, Sharpedo
will jet seawater from its backside, hurtling
toward the target to attack at 75 mph.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A3A-010.name: Mantine
A3A-010.description:
If it builds up enough speed swimming, it
can jump out above the waves and glide
for over 300 feet.

A3A-011.name: Carvanha
A3A-011.description:
It won't attack while it's alone—not even if it
spots prey. Instead, it waits for other Carvanha to
join it, and then the Pokémon attack as a group.

A3A-013.name: Shinx
A3A-013.description:
The extension and contraction of its muscles
generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

A3A-015.name: Luxray
A3A-015.description:
It can see clearly through walls to track down its
prey and seek its lost young.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon do −20 damage.

A3A-017.name: Zebstrika
A3A-017.description:
When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it
shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

A3A-016.name: Blitzle
A3A-016.description:
When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear.
It can catch lightning with its mane and store
the electricity.

A3A-020.name: Xurkitree
A3A-020.description:
Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently
a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

attacks.name: Electronica
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

A3A-021.name: Zeraora
A3A-021.description:
It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents
apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack,
they'll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

abilities.name: Thunderclap Flash
abilities.effect: At the end of your first turn, take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

A3A-018.name: Emolga
A3A-018.description:
As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles
with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can
cause a lot of trouble.

A3A-022.name: Clefairy
A3A-022.description:
It is said that happiness will come to those who
see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a
full moon.

attacks.name: Plasma Hurricane
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

A3A-023.name: Clefable
A3A-023.description:
A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will
run and hide the moment it senses people.

A3A-024.name: Phantump
A3A-024.description:
With a voice like a human child's, it cries out to
lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost
among the trees.

A3A-025.name: Trevenant
A3A-025.description:
People fear it due to a belief that it devours any
who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the
Pokémon it shares its woods with, it's kind.

A3A-027.name: Shiinotic
A3A-027.description:
Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to
sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing,
it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

abilities.name: Illuminate
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may put a random Pokémon from your deck into your hand.

A3A-026.name: Morelull
A3A-026.description:
It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone
seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.

A3A-030.name: Baltoy
A3A-030.description:
It moves while spinning around on its single foot.
Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on
their heads.

A3A-028.name: Meditite
A3A-028.description:
It never skips its daily yoga training. It heightens
its inner strength through meditation.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

A3A-031.name: Claydol
A3A-031.description:
This mysterious Pokémon started life as an ancient
clay figurine made over 20,000 years ago.

abilities.name: Heal Block
abilities.effect: Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) can't be healed.

A3A-029.name: Medicham
A3A-029.description:
Through yoga training, it gained the psychic
power to predict its foe's next move.

attacks.name: Lycanfang
attacks.effect: Discard a {F} Energy from this Pokémon.

A3A-032.name: Rockruff
A3A-032.description:
This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young.
Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures,
but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

A3A-035.name: Sandygast
A3A-035.description:
If it loses its shovel, it will stick something
else—like a branch—in its head to make
do until it finds another shovel.

A3A-034.name: Passimian
A3A-034.description:
This Pokémon battles by throwing hard berries.
It won't obey a Trainer who throws Poké Balls
without skill.

attacks.name: Let's Throw
attacks.effect: If Passimian is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

A3A-036.name: Palossand
A3A-036.description:
The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokémon
into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped,
it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

A3A-037.name: Alolan Meowth
A3A-037.description:
It's accustomed to luxury because it
used to live with Alolan royalty. As a
result, it's very picky about food.

attacks.name: Meddle
attacks.effect: Discard a random Pokémon Tool card from your opponent's hand.

A3A-038.name: Alolan Persian
A3A-038.description:
The round face of Alolan Persian is considered
to be a symbol of prosperity in the Alola region,
so these Pokémon are very well cared for.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

A3A-040.name: Krokorok
A3A-040.description:
Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see
even in the dead of night. They live in groups of
a few individuals.

A3A-039.name: Sandile
A3A-039.description:
It submerges itself in sand and moves as if
swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies
from finding it and maintains its temperature.

A3A-041.name: Krookodile
A3A-041.description:
After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it
twists its body around to rip its prey in half.

attacks.name: Poaching Fangs
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, a card is chosen at random from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

attacks.name: Grindcore
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A3A-042.name: Nihilego
A3A-042.description:
A life-form from another world, it was dubbed
a UB and is thought to produce a
strong neurotoxin.

abilities.name: More Poison
abilities.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon takes +10 damage from being Poisoned.

attacks.name: New Wave
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A3A-044.name: Poipole
A3A-044.description:
This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be
chosen as a first partner in its own world.

attacks.name: 2-Step
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Triplet Headbutt
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

A3A-048.name: Aron
A3A-048.description:
It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks—
to build up the steel armor that protects its body.

A3A-049.name: Lairon
A3A-049.description:
It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory
by bashing one another with their steel bodies.

A3A-051.name: Ferroseed
A3A-051.description:
It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging
to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

A3A-046.name: Alolan Diglett
A3A-046.description:
The metal-rich geology of this Pokémon's habitat
caused it to develop steel whiskers on its head.

attacks.name: Happened to Headbutt
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A3A-045.name: Naganadel
A3A-045.description:
It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid
inside its body. It is one of the organisms known
as UBs.

attacks.name: Electro House
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A3A-053.name: Stakataka
A3A-053.description:
It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one
appears to be made up of many life-forms
stacked one on top of each other.

attacks.name: Brass Rock
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

A3A-050.name: Aggron
A3A-050.description:
Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate
thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by
ramming into them horn first.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

A3A-052.name: Ferrothorn
A3A-052.description:
This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks,
and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb
the nutrients it finds within the stone.

abilities.name: Steel Spikes
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, do 20 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

A3A-054.name: Lillipup
A3A-054.description:
This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious.
It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect
information about its surroundings.

A3A-055.name: Herdier
A3A-055.description:
Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon.
So much so that there's a theory that Herdier was
the first Pokémon to partner with people.

A3A-056.name: Stoutland
A3A-056.description:
These Pokémon seem to enjoy living with humans.
Even a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up
to people in about three days.

abilities.name: Guard Dog Visage
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon cost 1 {C} more.

A3A-060.name: Type: Null
A3A-060.description:
A Pokémon weapon developed for a specific
mission, it went berserk during an experiment,
so it was cryogenically frozen.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

A3A-057.name: Stufful
A3A-057.description:
Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out
to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.

A3A-058.name: Bewear
A3A-058.description:
Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show
its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is
dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.

attacks.name: Superpowered Hug
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out.

A3A-059.name: Oranguru
A3A-059.description:
It normally spends its time meditating in the
treetops. It throws Poké Balls and gives other
Pokémon orders as it pleases.

A3A-061.name: Silvally
A3A-061.description:
This is its form once it has awakened and
evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is
greatly increased.

attacks.name: Brave Buddies
attacks.effect: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.

A3A-062.name: Celesteela
A3A-062.description:
One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings
can be detected coming from both of its
huge arms.

abilities.name: Ultra Thrusters
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may switch your Active Ultra Beast with 1 of your Benched Ultra Beasts.

attacks.name: Moombahton
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A3A-063.name: Beast Wall
A3A-063.effect:
You can use this card only if your opponent hasn't gotten any points.

During your opponent's next turn, all of your Ultra Beasts take −20 damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

A3A-066.name: Beastite
A3A-066.effect: Attacks used by the Ultra Beast this card is attached to do +10 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each point you have gotten.

A3A-064.name: Repel
A3A-064.effect: Switch out your opponent's Active Basic Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

A3A-065.name: Electrical Cord
A3A-065.effect: If the {L} Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, move 2 {L} Energy from that Pokémon and attach 1 Energy each to 2 of your Benched Pokémon.

You can use this card only if your opponent has gotten at least 1 point.

Choose 1 of your Ultra Beasts. Attach 2 random Energy from your discard pile to that Pokémon.

A3A-070.name: Rowlet
A3A-070.description:
It sends its feathers, which are as sharp
as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong,
so its kicks are also formidable.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

A3A-072.name: Blacephalon
A3A-072.description:
It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the
explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

attacks.name: Beat Punk
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 70 damage to itself.

A3A-073.name: Alolan Meowth
A3A-073.description:
It's accustomed to luxury because it
used to live with Alolan royalty. As a
result, it's very picky about food.

attacks.name: Meddle
attacks.effect: Discard a random Pokémon Tool card from your opponent's hand.

A3A-074.name: Silvally
A3A-074.description:
This is its form once it has awakened and
evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is
greatly increased.

attacks.name: Brave Buddies
attacks.effect: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.

A3A-071.name: Pheromosa
A3A-071.description:
A life-form that lives in another world, its body
is thin and supple, but it also possesses
great power.

attacks.name: Jump Blues
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A3A-075.name: Celesteela
A3A-075.description:
One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings
can be detected coming from both of its
huge arms.

abilities.name: Ultra Thrusters

attacks.name: Moombahton
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Plasma Hurricane
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Beat
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Big Beat.

attacks.name: Lycanfang
attacks.effect: Discard a {F} Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grindcore
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Triplet Headbutt
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

A3A-083.name: Lusamine
A3A-083.effect:
You can use this card only if your opponent has gotten at least 1 point.

Choose 1 of your Ultra Beasts. Attach 2 random Energy from your discard pile to that Pokémon.

A3A-082.name: Looker

attacks.name: Lycanfang

A3A-081.name: Gladion

attacks.name: Grindcore
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Plasma Hurricane
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Beat
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Big Beat.

A3A-089.name: Growlithe
A3A-089.description:
It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly
stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

A3A-090.name: Arcanine
A3A-090.description:
An ancient picture scroll shows that people
were captivated by its movement as it ran
through prairies.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Triplet Headbutt
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

A3A-092.name: Frogadier
A3A-092.description:
It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise
control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

A3A-091.name: Froakie
A3A-091.description:
It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back.
The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise
take when attacked.

A3A-093.name: Greninja
A3A-093.description:
It creates throwing stars out of compressed water.
When it spins them and throws them at high speed,
these stars can split metal in two.

abilities.name: Water Shuriken
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may do 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A3A-094.name: Jynx
A3A-094.description:
Its strange cries sound like human language.
There are some musicians who compose songs
for Jynx to sing.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A3A-095.name: Pidgey
A3A-095.description:
A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps
its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

A3A-096.name: Pidgeotto
A3A-096.description:
The claws on its feet are well developed.
It can carry prey such as an Exeggcute
to its nest over 60 miles away.

A3A-097.name: Pidgeot
A3A-097.description:
When hunting, it skims the surface of water
at high speed to pick off unwary prey such
as Magikarp.

abilities.name: Drive Off
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

A3A-098.name: Aerodactyl
A3A-098.description:
This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times.
Apparently even modern technology is incapable
of producing a perfectly restored specimen.

attacks.name: Primal Wingbeat
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent shuffles their Active Pokémon into their deck.

attacks.name: Powerful Bloom
attacks.effect: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Inferno Onrush
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Scattering Cyclone
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Primeval Law
abilities.effect: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon from their hand to evolve their Active Pokémon.

A3A-103.name: Nihilego
A3A-103.description:
A life-form from another world, it was dubbed
a UB and is thought to produce a
strong neurotoxin.

abilities.name: More Poison
abilities.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon takes +10 damage from being Poisoned.

attacks.name: New Wave
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A3B-005.name: Tsareena
A3B-005.description:
This Pokémon is proud and aggressive. However, it is
said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if
someone touches the crown on its calyx.

attacks.name: Kick Down
attacks.effect: Your opponent reveals a random card from their hand and shuffles it into their deck.

A3B-003.name: Bounsweet
A3B-003.description:
Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled-down
fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in
the past, when sweeteners were scarce.

A3B-004.name: Steenee
A3B-004.description:
Steenee spreads a sweet scent that
makes others feel invigorated. This same
scent is popular for antiperspirants.

A3B-006.name: Applin
A3B-006.description:
It grows by eating the flesh of an apple.
Applin uses its own body fluid to strengthen
the apple's skin and prevent it from rotting.

A3B-007.name: Appletun
A3B-007.description:
It feeds mainly on sweet apples. It will also eat
small bug Pokémon that are attracted by its
sweet nectar.

attacks.name: Sweets Relay
attacks.effect: If 1 of your Pokémon used Sweets Relay during your last turn, this attack does 30 more damage.

A3B-002.name: Leafeon
A3B-002.description:
When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of
sunshine, you'll know it is using photosynthesis
to produce clean air.

attacks.name: Leaf Blast
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each {G} Energy attached to this Pokémon.

A3B-001.name: Tropius
A3B-001.description:
It lives in tropical jungles. The bunch of fruit
around its neck is delicious. The fruit grows
twice a year.

A3B-008.name: Flareon
A3B-008.description:
Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and
exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees
Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Assisting Heater
attacks.effect: Take a {R} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Combust
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may attach a {R} Energy from your discard pile to this Pokémon. If you do, do 20 damage to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

A3B-010.name: Torkoal
A3B-010.description:
It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows
out black soot if it is endangered.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.effect: Discard a {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

A3B-011.name: Litten
A3B-011.description:
If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't
open up to you. Even if you do grow close,
giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

A3B-013.name: Incineroar
A3B-013.description:
Although it's rough mannered and egotistical, it
finds beating down unworthy opponents boring.
It gets motivated for stronger opponents.

attacks.name: Darkest Lariat
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

A3B-014.name: Salandit
A3B-014.description:
It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow,
rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic
gas to make them dizzy and take them down.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.effect: Discard a {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

A3B-016.name: Vaporeon
A3B-016.description:
It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with
a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

attacks.name: Hyper Whirlpool
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A3B-015.name: Salazzle
A3B-015.description:
Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with
poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring
movements to turn them into loyal servants.

A3B-012.name: Torracat
A3B-012.description:
Torracat will let its Trainer coddle it once they've
grown close, but it's a powerful, sharp-clawed
Pokémon, so its Trainer gets covered in scratches.

A3B-017.name: Glaceon
A3B-017.description:
It can control its body temperature at will.
This enables it to freeze the moisture in the
atmosphere, creating flurries of diamond dust.

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.effect: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A3B-020.name: Vanilluxe
A3B-020.description:
When its anger reaches a breaking point, this
Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes
every creature around it, be they friend or foe.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Sparkling Aria
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

A3B-025.name: Jolteon
A3B-025.description:
It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted
by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Beginning Bolt
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon evolved during this turn, this attack does 20 more damage.

A3B-022.name: Popplio
A3B-022.description:
The balloons it inflates with its nose grow
larger and larger as it practices day by day.

A3B-021.name: Alomomola
A3B-021.description:
It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its
fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

A3B-026.name: Joltik
A3B-026.description:
Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon.
It's soaking up static electricity because it can't
produce a charge on its own.

attacks.name: Jolt
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

A3B-018.name: Vanillite
A3B-018.description:
Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself
comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to
cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.

attacks.name: Sweets Relay
attacks.effect: If 1 of your Pokémon used Sweets Relay during your last turn, this attack does 20 more damage.

A3B-019.name: Vanillish
A3B-019.description:
By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body.
This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with
warm, sunny weather.

attacks.name: Sweets Relay
attacks.effect: If 1 of your Pokémon used Sweets Relay during your last turn, this attack does 20 more damage.

A3B-023.name: Brionne
A3B-023.description:
It gets excited when it sees a dance it
doesn't know. This hard worker practices
diligently until it can learn that dance.

A3B-028.name: Espeon
A3B-028.description:
The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is
predicting its opponent's next move.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

A3B-027.name: Galvantula
A3B-027.description:
It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its
means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could
be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.effect: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

A3B-029.name: Woobat
A3B-029.description:
While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots
of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it's
evidence that Woobat live there.

A3B-030.name: Swoobat
A3B-030.description:
Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out.
Afterward, it won't be able to fly for a
little while.

A3B-031.name: Swirlix
A3B-031.description:
It eats its own weight in sugar every day.
If it doesn't get enough sugar, it becomes
incredibly grumpy.

attacks.name: Sweets Relay
attacks.effect: If 1 of your Pokémon used Sweets Relay during your last turn, this attack does 20 more damage.

A3B-032.name: Slurpuff
A3B-032.description:
By taking in a person's scent, it can sniff out their
mental and physical condition. It's hoped that
this skill will have many medical applications.

attacks.name: Sweets Relay
attacks.effect: If 1 of your Pokémon used Sweets Relay during your last turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

A3B-033.name: Sylveon
A3B-033.description:
This Pokémon uses its ribbonlike feelers to send
a soothing aura into its opponents, erasing
their hostility.

attacks.name: Evoharmony
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 more damage for each Evolution Pokémon on your Bench.

A3B-036.name: Milcery
A3B-036.description:
This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling
particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.

attacks.name: Sweets Relay
attacks.effect: If 1 of your Pokémon used Sweets Relay during your last turn, this attack does 20 more damage.

A3B-038.name: Barboach
A3B-038.description:
Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in
muddy waters, it can detect its prey's location.

abilities.name: Happy Ribbon
