A3B-039.name: Whiscash
A3B-039.description:
It is extremely protective of its territory. If any
foe approaches, it attacks using vicious tremors.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.effect: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon.

A3B-041.name: Mienshao
A3B-041.description:
When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging
opponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the
fur on its arms.

A3B-035.name: Mimikyu
A3B-035.description:
This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by
sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides
itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.

attacks.name: Try to Imitate
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

A3B-037.name: Alcremie
A3B-037.description:
When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them
to berries it's decorated with cream.

attacks.name: Sweets Overload
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 damage for each time your Pokémon used Sweets Relay during this game.

A3B-040.name: Mienfoo
A3B-040.description:
In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop
with its arms more than 100 times.

attacks.name: Kick Shot
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A3B-042.name: Carbink
A3B-042.description:
When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all
out by firing high-energy beams from the gems
embedded in its body.

attacks.name: Hard Roll
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

A3B-043.name: Umbreon
A3B-043.description:
When exposed to the moon's aura, the rings on its
body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.

attacks.name: Dark Binding
attacks.effect: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

A3B-046.name: Liepard
A3B-046.description:
Don't be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant
figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

A3B-044.name: Sableye
A3B-044.description:
Materials from gems it has eaten float to the
surface of its body and can form an infinite
number of patterns among individuals.

A3B-045.name: Purrloin
A3B-045.description:
Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable
behavior come away with stinging scratches from
its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.

attacks.name: Playful Knockdown

A3B-047.name: Mawile
A3B-047.description:
It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into
complacency, then bites with its huge,
relentless jaws.

attacks.name: Powerful Vise
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

A3B-048.name: Togedemaru
A3B-048.description:
With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon
takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon.
It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.

attacks.name: Bristling Spikes
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack, do 30 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

A3B-049.name: Meltan
A3B-049.description:
It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid
metal within its body is how it generates energy.

A3B-051.name: Dratini
A3B-051.description:
It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger.
During this process, it is protected by a rapid
waterfall.

A3B-054.name: Drampa
A3B-054.description:
The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles
in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play
with the children living in the towns below.

attacks.name: Dragon Breath
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

A3B-052.name: Dragonair
A3B-052.description:
They say that if it emits an aura from its whole
body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

A3B-055.name: Eevee
A3B-055.description:
Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to
adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.effect: Draw a card.

abilities.name: Veevee 'volve

A3B-058.name: Aipom
A3B-058.description:
As it did more and more with its tail, its hands
became clumsy. It makes its nest high in
the treetops.

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, heal 20 damage from it.

attacks.name: Flop-Down Punch
attacks.effect: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

A3B-061.name: Audino
A3B-061.description:
This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers,
Audino can gauge other creatures' feelings and physical conditions.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

A3B-062.name: Minccino
A3B-062.description:
The way it brushes away grime with its tail
can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on
spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.

A3B-059.name: Ambipom
A3B-059.description:
It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both
of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze,
that's proof it really likes you.

abilities.name: Catching Tail

A3B-050.name: Melmetal
A3B-050.description:
At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and
fall apart. The small shards left behind will
eventually be reborn as Meltan.

A3B-063.name: Cinccino
A3B-063.description:
Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads
over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust.
Cinccino won't tolerate even a speck of the stuff.

A3B-060.name: Chatot
A3B-060.description:
It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them
into thinking it's one of them. This way they won't
attack it.

attacks.name: Tone-Deaf

A3B-064.name: Skwovet
A3B-064.description:
It stores berries in its cheeks. When there are no
berries to be found, Skwovet will stuff pebbles
into its cheeks to stave off its cravings.

A3B-071.name: Flareon
A3B-071.description:
Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and

A3B-078.description:

A3B-076.description:

A3B-065.description:
This Pokémon makes off with heaps of fallen berries by wrapping

attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

abilities.name: Happy Ribbon
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may draw 2 cards.

abilities.name: Full-Mouth Manner
abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, heal 20 damage from it.

attacks.name: Flop-Down Punch
attacks.effect: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

A3B-085.name: Hau
A3B-085.effect: During this turn, attacks used by your Decidueye ex, Incineroar ex, or Primarina ex do +30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Sparkling Aria
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

A3B-086.name: Penny
A3B-086.effect: Look at a random Supporter card that's not Penny from your opponent's deck and shuffle it back into their deck. Use the effect of that card as the effect of this card.

abilities.name: Full-Mouth Manner
abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, heal 20 damage from it.

attacks.name: Flop-Down Punch
attacks.effect: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

A3B-094.name: Lapras
A3B-094.description:
A smart and kindhearted Pokémon,
it glides across the surface of the sea while
its beautiful song echoes around it.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 70 more damage.

abilities.name: Happy Ribbon
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may draw 2 cards.

abilities.name: Combust
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may attach a {R} Energy from your discard pile to this Pokémon. If you do, do 20 damage to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Combust
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may attach a {R} Energy from your discard pile to this Pokémon. If you do, do 20 damage to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.effect: Discard 2 {R} Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Sparkling Aria
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

A3B-095.name: Voltorb
A3B-095.description:
It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden
jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

attacks.name: Big Explosion
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

A3B-096.name: Electrode
A3B-096.description:
The more energy it charges up, the faster
it gets. But this also makes it more likely
to explode.

A3B-097.name: Ralts
A3B-097.description:
The horns on its head provide a strong power
that enables it to sense people's emotions.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

A3B-098.name: Kirlia
A3B-098.description:
It has a psychic power that enables it to distort
the space around it and see into the future.

A3B-093.name: Pinsir
A3B-093.description:
These Pokémon judge one another based on
pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make
for more popularity with the opposite gender.

attacks.name: Guillotine Rush
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

A3B-099.name: Gardevoir
A3B-099.description:
To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic
power to create a small black hole.

abilities.name: Psy Shadow
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may take a {P} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to the {P} Pokémon in the Active Spot.

A3B-100.name: Ekans
A3B-100.description:
By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger
than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.

A3B-101.name: Arbok
A3B-101.description:
The latest research has determined that there
are over 20 possible arrangements of the
patterns on its stomach.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

abilities.name: Veevee 'volve
abilities.effect: This Pokémon can evolve into any Pokémon that evolves from Eevee if you play it from your hand onto this Pokémon. (This Pokémon can't evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.)

A3B-102.name: Farfetch'd
A3B-102.description:
The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves
as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire
situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

attacks.name: Inferno Dance
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. Take an amount of {R} Energy from your Energy Zone equal to the number of heads and attach it to your Benched {R} Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Thundering Hurricane
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Energized Blade
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A4-001.name: Oddish
A4-001.description:
If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move.
It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.effect: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A3B-107.name: Eevee Bag
A3B-107.effect:
Choose 1:

During this turn, attacks used by your Pokémon that evolve from Eevee do +10 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon that evolves from Eevee.

A4-002.name: Gloom
A4-002.description:
Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor.
The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance
of 1.25 miles.

A4-004.name: Tangela
A4-004.description:
Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows
nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this
Pokémon's true appearance remains a mystery.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

A4-005.name: Tangrowth
A4-005.description:
Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it
pleases. Recent research has shown that these
arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.

attacks.name: Grass Knot
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 more damage for each Energy in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

A4-006.name: Scyther
A4-006.description:
It slashes through grass with its sharp
scythes, moving too fast for the human
eye to track.

A4-003.name: Bellossom
A4-003.description:
Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals
rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

A4-007.name: Pinsir
A4-007.description:
These Pokémon judge one another based on
pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make
for more popularity with the opposite gender.

A4-008.name: Chikorita
A4-008.description:
A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its
head. It is docile and loves to soak up sun rays.

A4-009.name: Bayleef
A4-009.description:
A spicy aroma emanates from around its neck.
The aroma acts as a stimulant to restore health.

A4-010.name: Meganium
A4-010.description:
The aroma that rises from its petals contains a
substance that calms aggressive feelings.

attacks.name: Bloomshine
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

A4-011.name: Ledyba
A4-011.description:
These very cowardly Pokémon join together and
use Reflect to protect their nest.

A4-012.name: Ledian
A4-012.description:
It's said that the patterns on its back are
related to the stars in the night sky, but the
details of that relationship remain unclear.

A4-013.name: Hoppip
A4-013.description:
Outside of cold regions, Hoppip can be found
practically everywhere. This is because the wind
carries this species all over the world.

A4-014.name: Skiploom
A4-014.description:
Skiploom enthusiasts can apparently tell where a
Skiploom was born by the scent drifting from the
flower on the Pokémon's head.

A4-015.name: Jumpluff
A4-015.description:
Jumpluff travels on seasonal winds. Once its
cotton spores run out, its journey ends, as does
its life.

abilities.name: Fluffy Flight
abilities.effect: Your Active Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

A4-016.name: Sunkern
A4-016.description:
It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning.
Knowing it's weak, it simply feeds until it evolves.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.effect: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

A4-018.name: Yanma
A4-018.description:
Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its
head. It won't miss prey—even those behind it.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4-020.name: Pineco
A4-020.description:
It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it
from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.

A4-019.name: Yanmega
A4-019.description:
It prefers to battle by biting apart foes' heads
instantly while flying by at high speed.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

attacks.name: Triple Slap
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

A4-024.name: Cherrim
A4-024.description:
After absorbing plenty of sunlight, Cherrim takes
this form. It's full of energy while it's like this,
and its liveliness will go on until sundown.

A4-017.name: Sunflora
A4-017.description:
In the daytime, it rushes about in a hectic
manner, but it comes to a complete stop when
the sun sets.

A4-022.name: Heracross
A4-022.description:
It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to
itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.

attacks.name: Single Lunge
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has no damage on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

A4-023.name: Cherubi
A4-023.description:
It nimbly dashes about to avoid getting pecked
by bird Pokémon that would love to make off
with its small, nutrient-rich storage ball.

abilities.name: En-fruits-iastic
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, attacks used by this Pokémon cost 1 less {G} Energy.

attacks.name: Sweets Relay
attacks.effect: If 1 of your Pokémon used Sweets Relay during your last turn, this attack does 20 more damage.

A4-026.name: Ninetales
A4-026.description:
It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails
is loaded with supernatural powers.

attacks.name: Scorching Breath
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

A4-027.name: Cyndaquil
A4-027.description:
It is timid and always curls itself up in a ball.
If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.

A4-029.name: Typhlosion
A4-029.description:
If its rage peaks, it becomes so hot that anything
that touches it will instantly go up in flames.

abilities.name: Fire Breath
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Burned.

A4-030.name: Slugma
A4-030.description:
A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers
around in a constant search for warm places.

A4-031.name: Magcargo
A4-031.description:
Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames
that circulate throughout its body.

attacks.name: Spurt Fire
attacks.effect: 1 other Pokémon (either yours or your opponent's) is chosen at random 3 times. For each time a Pokémon was chosen, do 50 damage to it.

A4-028.name: Quilava
A4-028.description:
Before battle, it turns its back on its opponent to
demonstrate how ferociously its fire blazes.

A4-033.name: Entei
A4-033.description:
A Pokémon that races across the land. It is said
that one is born every time a new volcano appears.

attacks.name: Strong Flare
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 random Energy from this Pokémon.

A4-035.name: Darumaka
A4-035.description:
It derives its power from fire burning inside
its body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokémon will
immediately fall asleep.

A4-036.name: Darmanitan
A4-036.description:
The thick arms of this hot-blooded Pokémon
can deliver punches capable of obliterating a
dump truck.

attacks.name: Phoenix Turbo
attacks.effect: Take a {R}, {W}, and {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach them to your Benched Basic Pokémon in any way you like.

A4-037.name: Heatmor
A4-037.description:
There's a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in
the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the
hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.

attacks.name: Roasting Heat
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Burned, this attack does 60 more damage.

A4-032.name: Magby
A4-032.description:
This Pokémon is still small and timid.
Whenever Magby gets excited or surprised,
flames leak from its mouth and its nose.

attacks.name: Toasty Toss
attacks.effect: Take a {R} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Basic Pokémon.

A4-025.name: Vulpix
A4-025.description:
While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it
grows, several new tails are sprouted.

A4-041.name: Horsea
A4-041.description:
Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle
currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits
out pitch-black ink and escapes.

A4-038.name: Poliwag
A4-038.description:
For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking.
The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of
the Pokémon's innards showing through the skin.

A4-039.name: Poliwhirl
A4-039.description:
Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness.
This trait of Poliwhirl's has been used in place of
lullabies to get children to go to sleep.

A4-042.name: Seadra
A4-042.description:
It's the males that raise the offspring. While
Seadra are raising young, the spines on their
backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.

A4-046.name: Totodile
A4-046.description:
It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to
take a bite out of anything that moves.

attacks.name: Stormy Prison
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

A4-047.name: Croconaw
A4-047.description:
If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its
place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

A4-044.name: Magikarp
A4-044.description:
An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may
jump high on rare occasions but never more
than seven feet.

attacks.name: Splashing Dodge
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

A4-045.name: Gyarados
A4-045.description:
Once it appears, it goes on a rampage.
It remains enraged until it demolishes
everything around it.

attacks.name: Wild Swing
attacks.effect: You may discard any number of your Benched {W} Pokémon. This attack does 40 more damage for each Benched Pokémon you discarded in this way.

A4-050.name: Azumarill
A4-050.description:
Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish
the movements of things in water and tell what
they are.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −30 damage from attacks from {R} or {W} Pokémon.

A4-048.name: Feraligatr
A4-048.description:
It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding
speed when it attacks and bites prey.

attacks.name: Destructive Whirlpool
attacks.effect: Discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A4-051.name: Wooper
A4-051.description:
This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the
water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

A4-054.name: Corsola
A4-054.description:
It will regrow any branches that break off its
head. People keep particularly beautiful Corsola
branches as charms to promote safe childbirth.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.effect: Put a random Pokémon from your deck into your hand.

A4-053.name: Qwilfish
A4-053.description:
Be cautious if this Pokémon starts sucking in
water—it will soon attack by scattering the toxic
spikes that grow all over its body.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A4-055.name: Remoraid
A4-055.description:
The water they shoot from their mouths can hit
moving prey from more than 300 feet away.

A4-052.name: Quagsire
A4-052.description:
It has an easygoing nature. It doesn't care if it
bumps its head on boats and boulders
while swimming.

A4-057.name: Delibird
A4-057.description:
It carries food all day long. There are tales about
lost people who were saved by the food it had.

attacks.name: Stumbling Draw
attacks.effect: Draw a card.

A4-056.name: Octillery
A4-056.description:
Its instinct is to bury itself in holes. It often steals
the nesting holes of others to sleep in them.

attacks.name: Octazooka
attacks.effect: If the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen. This effect lasts until the Defending Pokémon leaves the Active Spot, and it doesn't stack.

A4-040.name: Politoed
A4-040.description:
At nightfall, these Pokémon appear on the shores
of lakes. They announce their territorial claims by
letting out cries that sound like shouting.

abilities.name: Lordly Cheering
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, attacks used by your Pokémon that evolve from Poliwhirl do +40 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A4-049.name: Marill
A4-049.description:
The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can
stay dry even when it plays in the water.

A4-058.name: Mantine
A4-058.description:
While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores
Remoraid that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.

attacks.name: Dive
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

A4-059.name: Suicune
A4-059.description:
It races around the world to purify fouled water.
It dashes away with the north wind.

attacks.name: Cure Stream
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do −20 damage.

A4-062.name: Ducklett
A4-062.description:
When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water,
escaping under cover of the spray.

A4-063.name: Swanna
A4-063.description:
Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap
their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.

attacks.name: Feathery Cyclone
attacks.effect: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4-064.name: Chinchou
A4-064.description:
Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both
positive and negative charges flowing through them.

attacks.name: Flashing Signal
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

A4-067.name: Mareep
A4-067.description:
If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece
doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.

A4-070.name: Elekid
A4-070.description:
When a storm approaches, this Pokémon gets
restless. Once Elekid hears the sound of thunder,
it gets full-on rowdy.

attacks.name: Zappy Shot
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A4-068.name: Flaaffy
A4-068.description:
As a result of storing too much electricity,
it developed patches where even downy
wool won't grow.

A4-069.name: Ampharos
A4-069.description:
The bright light on its tail can be seen far
away. It has been treasured since ancient
times as a beacon.

attacks.name: Thunder Punch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A4-071.name: Raikou
A4-071.description:
The rain clouds it carries let it fire thunderbolts
at will. They say that it descended with lightning.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A4-060.name: Corphish
A4-060.description:
No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will
adapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.

A4-066.name: Pichu
A4-066.description:
It is unskilled at storing electric power.
Any kind of shock causes it to discharge
energy spontaneously.

attacks.name: Crackly Toss
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Basic Pokémon.

A4-074.name: Slowking
A4-074.description:
When its head was bitten, toxins entered Slowpoke's
head and unlocked an extraordinary power.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A4-061.name: Crawdaunt
A4-061.description:
A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws.
It is said to be extremely hard to raise.

abilities.name: Unruly Claw
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A4-073.name: Slowpoke
A4-073.description:
It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five
seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.effect: This Pokémon is now Asleep. Heal 30 damage from it.

A4-072.name: Emolga
A4-072.description:
As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles
with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can
cause a lot of trouble.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.effect: This attack also does 10 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4-077.name: Cleffa
A4-077.description:
According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen
in places where shooting stars have fallen.

attacks.name: Twinkly Call
attacks.effect: Put a random Pokémon from your deck into your hand.

A4-075.name: Smoochum
A4-075.description:
If its face gets even slightly dirty, Smoochum will
bathe immediately. But if its body gets dirty,
Smoochum doesn't really seem to care.

attacks.name: Shivery Wave
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A4-076.name: Jynx
A4-076.description:
Its strange cries sound like human language.
There are some musicians who compose songs
for Jynx to sing.

attacks.name: Attract Smack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

A4-078.name: Togepi
A4-078.description:
The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said
that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do −20 damage.

A4-079.name: Togetic
A4-079.description:
They say that it will appear before kindhearted,
caring people and shower them with happiness.

A4-081.name: Natu
A4-081.description:
It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and
likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.

A4-082.name: Xatu
A4-082.description:
They say that it stays still and quiet because it is
seeing both the past and future at the same time.

attacks.name: Life Drain
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon's remaining HP is now 10.

A4-080.name: Togekiss
A4-080.description:
These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near
conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they've hardly
been seen at all.

abilities.name: Celestial Blessing
abilities.effect: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

abilities.name: Psychic Healing
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

A4-084.name: Unown
A4-084.description:
Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape
appears to have some meaning.

abilities.name: GUARD
abilities.effect: This Ability works if you have any Unown in play with an Ability other than . All of your Pokémon take −10 damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

A4-088.name: Snubbull
A4-088.description:
It grows close to others easily and is also easily
spoiled. The disparity between its face and its
actions makes many young people wild about it.

A4-087.name: Girafarig
A4-087.description:
Girafarig's tail has a small head. It instinctively
bites at any foe that approaches the Pokémon
from behind.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

A4-089.name: Granbull
A4-089.description:
While it has powerful jaws, it doesn't care for
disputes, so it rarely has a chance to display
their might.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A4-090.name: Munna
A4-090.description:
Late at night, it appears beside people's pillows.
As it feeds on dreams, the patterns on its body
give off a faint glow.

A4-085.name: Unown
A4-085.description:
Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape
appears to have some meaning.

abilities.name: POWER
abilities.effect: This Ability works if you have any Unown in play with an Ability other than . Attacks used by your Pokémon do +10 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A4-086.name: Wobbuffet
A4-086.description:
It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its
body to pump up its counterstrike.

attacks.name: Reply Strongly
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn while it was in the Active Spot, this attack does 50 more damage.

A4-091.name: Musharna
A4-091.description:
When dark mists emanate from its body, don't
get too near. If you do, your nightmares will
become reality.

attacks.name: Dream Dance
attacks.effect: Both Active Pokémon are now Asleep.

A4-092.name: Onix
A4-092.description:
As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many
hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.

A4-093.name: Sudowoodo
A4-093.description:
Although it always pretends to be a tree,
its composition appears more similar to
rock than to vegetation.

A4-094.name: Gligar
A4-094.description:
It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey,
it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.

A4-095.name: Gliscor
A4-095.description:
It observes prey while hanging inverted from
branches. When the chance presents itself,
it swoops!

A4-096.name: Swinub
A4-096.description:
It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up
food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

A4-097.name: Piloswine
A4-097.description:
If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back
stand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.

A4-098.name: Mamoswine
A4-098.description:
This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings
from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a
while, it was thought to have gone extinct.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon.

A4-099.name: Phanpy
A4-099.description:
This Pokémon lives and nests on a riverbank.
After playing in the mud, it won't be able to
settle down unless it washes its body.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

A4-101.name: Tyrogue
A4-101.description:
It is always bursting with energy. To make itself
stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.

attacks.name: Gigantic Press
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {F} Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

A4-102.name: Hitmontop
A4-102.description:
It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high
speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

attacks.name: Piercing Spin
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A4-103.name: Larvitar
A4-103.description:
Born deep underground, this Pokémon
becomes a pupa after eating enough
dirt to make a mountain.

A4-104.name: Pupitar
A4-104.description:
This pupa flies around wildly by venting with
great force the gas pressurized inside its body.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −30 damage from attacks.

A4-107.name: Zubat
A4-107.description:
It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check
its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies
around with skill.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A4-106.name: Barbaracle
A4-106.description:
Seven Binacle come together to form one
Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head
gives orders to those serving as the limbs.

A4-110.name: Spinarak
A4-110.description:
It lies still in the same pose for days in its web,
waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.

attacks.name: Venomous Slash
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A4-111.name: Ariados
A4-111.description:
Every night, it wanders around in search of
prey, whose movements it restrains by spewing
threads before it bites into them with its fangs.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

abilities.name: Dark Chase
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has damage on it to the Active Spot.

A4-113.name: Murkrow
A4-113.description:
Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to
bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent reveals a random card from their hand and shuffles it into their deck.

A4-116.name: Weavile
A4-116.description:
Evolution made it even more devious.
It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.

A4-118.name: Houndoom
A4-118.description:
If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its
mouth, the pain will never go away.

attacks.name: Diving Swipe
attacks.effect: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

A4-115.name: Sneasel
A4-115.description:
This cunning Pokémon hides under the cover of
darkness, waiting to attack its prey.

A4-119.name: Tyranitar
A4-119.description:
Extremely strong, it can change the landscape.
It is so insolent that it doesn't care about others.

abilities.name: Energy Plunder
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may move all {D} Energy from each of your Pokémon to this Pokémon.

A4-120.name: Absol
A4-120.description:
Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and
mountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely
sensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.

attacks.name: Leap Over
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

A4-121.name: Forretress
A4-121.description:
It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters
pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.

A4-123.name: Scizor
A4-123.description:
This Pokémon's pincers, which contain steel, can
crush any hard object they get ahold of into bits.

attacks.name: Gale Thrust
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.

A4-126.name: Klink
A4-126.description:
The two minigears that compose this Pokémon
are closer than twins. They mesh well only with
each other.

A4-125.name: Mawile
A4-125.description:
It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into
complacency, then bites with its huge,
relentless jaws.

A4-122.name: Steelix
A4-122.description:
It is said that if an Onix lives for over 100 years,
its composition changes to become diamond-like.

A4-108.name: Golbat
A4-108.description:
It loves to drink other creatures' blood. It's said
that if it finds others of its kind going hungry,
it sometimes shares the blood it's gathered.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A4-105.name: Binacle
A4-105.description:
After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they
adhere themselves to it and live together.
They cooperate to gather food during high tide.

attacks.name: Dual Chop
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

A4-117.name: Houndour
A4-117.description:
It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a
variety of cries for communicating with others.

A4-114.name: Honchkrow
A4-114.description:
It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never
forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.

A4-128.name: Klinklang
A4-128.description:
From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of
electricity. Its red core contains an enormous
amount of energy.

attacks.name: Gear Spinner
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Gear Spinner attack does +70 damage.

A4-127.name: Klang
A4-127.description:
When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up
perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and
this Pokémon's rotation speed increases sharply.

A4-129.name: Spearow
A4-129.description:
Its reckless nature leads it to stand up to
others—even large Pokémon—if it has to protect
its territory.

A4-132.name: Blissey
A4-132.description:
Anyone who takes even one taste of Blissey's
egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant
to everyone.

attacks.name: Energy Blow
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to this Pokémon.

A4-130.name: Fearow
A4-130.description:
Carrying food through Fearow's territory is
dangerous. It will snatch the food away from
you in a flash!

attacks.name: Peck Bugs
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a {G} Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

A4-131.name: Chansey
A4-131.description:
This kindly Pokémon lays highly nutritious eggs
and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

A4-133.name: Kangaskhan
A4-133.description:
Although it's carrying its baby in a pouch on
its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It
intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

A4-134.name: Eevee
A4-134.description:
Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to
adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.effect: Put a random Pokémon from your deck into your hand.

A4-135.name: Porygon
A4-135.description:
State-of-the-art technology was used to create
Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be
created via computer programming.

A4-139.name: Furret
A4-139.description:
The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up
around them. It corners foes with speed.

attacks.name: Tail Smash
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A4-137.name: Porygon-Z
A4-137.description:
Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to
move between dimensions, but the program also
caused instability in Porygon-Z's behavior.

attacks.name: Slowing Beam
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon cost 1 {C} more.

A4-136.name: Porygon2
A4-136.description:
This is a Porygon that was updated with special
data. Porygon2 develops itself by learning about
many different subjects all on its own.

abilities.name: Buggy Evolution
abilities.effect: Whenever you attach an Energy from your Energy Zone to this Pokémon, put a random card from your deck that evolves from this Pokémon onto this Pokémon to evolve it.

A4-138.name: Sentret
A4-138.description:
When acting as a lookout, it warns others of danger
by screeching and hitting the ground with its tail.

A4-140.name: Hoothoot
A4-140.description:
It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so
fast, the movement can rarely be seen.

abilities.name: Insomnia
abilities.effect: This Pokémon can't be Asleep.

A4-141.name: Noctowl
A4-141.description:
Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to
see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

A4-142.name: Aipom
A4-142.description:
As it did more and more with its tail, its hands
became clumsy. It makes its nest high in
the treetops.

attacks.name: Imitate
attacks.effect: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent.

A4-143.name: Ambipom
A4-143.description:
It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both
of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze,
that's proof it really likes you.

A4-144.name: Dunsparce
A4-144.description:
It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted,
it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.

attacks.name: Sudden Flash
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

A4-145.name: Teddiursa
A4-145.description:
Its paws are soaked in oodles of honey. When
nervous, Teddiursa will lick its paws and soon
have a smile back on its face.

attacks.name: Honey Snack
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

A4-146.name: Ursaring
A4-146.description:
It usually wears a hardened expression, but when
it's licking up honey—which it loves—the joy it
feels will cause it to break into a wide grin.

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

A4-147.name: Stantler
A4-147.description:
This Pokémon apparently used to live in much
harsher environments, and thus it once had
stronger psychic powers than it does now.

attacks.name: Enhanced Horns
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 50 more damage.

A4-148.name: Smeargle
A4-148.description:
The fluid of Smeargle's tail secretions changes
in the intensity of its hue as the Pokémon's
emotions change.

attacks.name: Splatter Coating
attacks.effect: Change the type of a random Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of the following at random: {G}, {R}, {W}, {L}, {P}, {F}, {D}, or {M}.

attacks.name: Elemental Blast
attacks.effect: Discard a {R}, {W}, and {L} Energy from this Pokémon.

A4-150.name: Bouffalant
A4-150.description:
These Pokémon can crush a car with no more
than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on
their heads hold higher positions within the herd.

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

A4-151.name: Elemental Switch
A4-151.effect: Move a {R}, {W}, or {L} Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

A4-152.name: Squirt Bottle
A4-152.effect: Discard a {R} Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

A4-153.name: Steel Apron
A4-153.effect: The {M} Pokémon this card is attached to takes −10 damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon, recovers from all Special Conditions, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

A4-155.name: Rescue Scarf
A4-155.effect: If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, put it into your hand instead of the discard pile.

A4-156.name: Will
A4-156.effect: The next time you flip any number of coins for the effect of an attack, Ability, or Trainer card after using this card on this turn, the first coin flip will definitely be heads.

A4-154.name: Dark Pendant
A4-154.effect: If the {D} Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, your opponent reveals a random card from their hand and shuffles it into their deck.

A4-159.name: Fisher
A4-159.effect: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, a {W} Pokémon is chosen at random from your discard pile and put into your hand.

A4-157.name: Lyra
A4-157.effect: Switch your Active Pokémon that has damage on it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4-158.name: Silver
A4-158.effect: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a Supporter card you find there and shuffle it into your opponent's deck.

A4-160.name: Jasmine
A4-160.effect: During your opponent's next turn, all of your Steelix and Skarmory ex take −50 damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

A4-161.name: Hiker
A4-161.effect: For each of your {F} Pokémon in play, look at that many cards from the top of your deck and put them back in any order.

A4-162.name: Chikorita
A4-162.description:
A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its
head. It is docile and loves to soak up sun rays.

A4-163.name: Bellossom
A4-163.description:
Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals
rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

A4-165.name: Cyndaquil
A4-165.description:
It is timid and always curls itself up in a ball.
If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.

A4-166.name: Magby
A4-166.description:
This Pokémon is still small and timid.
Whenever Magby gets excited or surprised,
flames leak from its mouth and its nose.

attacks.name: Toasty Toss
attacks.effect: Take a {R} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Basic Pokémon.

A4-164.name: Heracross
A4-164.description:
It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to
itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.

attacks.name: Single Lunge
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has no damage on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

A4-167.name: Totodile
A4-167.description:
It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to
take a bite out of anything that moves.

A4-169.name: Octillery
A4-169.description:
Its instinct is to bury itself in holes. It often steals
the nesting holes of others to sleep in them.

attacks.name: Octazooka
attacks.effect: If the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen. This effect lasts until the Defending Pokémon leaves the Active Spot, and it doesn't stack.

A4-170.name: Delibird
A4-170.description:
It carries food all day long. There are tales about
lost people who were saved by the food it had.

attacks.name: Stumbling Draw
attacks.effect: Draw a card.

A4-171.name: Pichu
A4-171.description:
It is unskilled at storing electric power.
Any kind of shock causes it to discharge
energy spontaneously.

attacks.name: Crackly Toss
attacks.effect: Take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Basic Pokémon.

A4-168.name: Qwilfish
A4-168.description:
Be cautious if this Pokémon starts sucking in
water—it will soon attack by scattering the toxic
spikes that grow all over its body.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A4-172.name: Ampharos
A4-172.description:
The bright light on its tail can be seen far
away. It has been treasured since ancient
times as a beacon.

attacks.name: Thunder Punch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A4-173.name: Togepi
A4-173.description:
The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said
that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do −20 damage.

A4-174.name: Xatu
A4-174.description:
They say that it stays still and quiet because it is
seeing both the past and future at the same time.

attacks.name: Life Drain
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon's remaining HP is now 10.

A4-175.name: Wobbuffet
A4-175.description:
It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its
body to pump up its counterstrike.

attacks.name: Reply Strongly
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn while it was in the Active Spot, this attack does 50 more damage.

A4-176.name: Gligar
A4-176.description:
It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey,
it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.

A4-177.name: Spinarak
A4-177.description:
It lies still in the same pose for days in its web,
waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.

A4-178.name: Murkrow
A4-178.description:
Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to
bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent reveals a random card from their hand and shuffles it into their deck.

A4-180.name: Scizor
A4-180.description:
This Pokémon's pincers, which contain steel, can
crush any hard object they get ahold of into bits.

attacks.name: Gale Thrust
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.

A4-179.name: Tyranitar
A4-179.description:
Extremely strong, it can change the landscape.
It is so insolent that it doesn't care about others.

abilities.name: Energy Plunder
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may move all {D} Energy from each of your Pokémon to this Pokémon.

A4-181.name: Sentret
A4-181.description:
When acting as a lookout, it warns others of danger
by screeching and hitting the ground with its tail.

A4-182.name: Hoothoot
A4-182.description:
It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so
fast, the movement can rarely be seen.

abilities.name: Insomnia
abilities.effect: This Pokémon can't be Asleep.

A4-183.name: Stantler
A4-183.description:
This Pokémon apparently used to live in much
harsher environments, and thus it once had
stronger psychic powers than it does now.

attacks.name: Enhanced Horns
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 50 more damage.

A4-185.name: Blissey
A4-185.description:
Anyone who takes even one taste of Blissey's
egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant
to everyone.

attacks.name: Energy Blow
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to this Pokémon.

A4-184.description:
The fluid of Smeargle's tail secretions changes
in the intensity of its hue as the Pokémon's
emotions change.

attacks.effect: Change the type of a random Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of the following at random: {G}, {R}, {W}, {L}, {P}, {F}, {D}, or {M}.

attacks.effect: Take a {R}, {W}, and {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach them to your Benched Basic Pokémon in any way you like.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Venomous Slash

abilities.name: Dark Chase
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has damage on it to the Active Spot.

attacks.name: Elemental Blast
attacks.effect: Discard a {R}, {W}, and {L} Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

A4-213.name: Flareon
A4-213.description:
Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated,
and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000
degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Assisting Heater
attacks.effect: Take a {R} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Phoenix Turbo
attacks.effect: Take a {R}, {W}, and {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach them to your Benched Basic Pokémon in any way you like.

A4-212.name: Yanma
A4-212.description:
Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its
head. It won't miss prey—even those behind it.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4-214.name: Magikarp
A4-214.description:
An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may
jump high on rare occasions but never more
than seven feet.

attacks.name: Leap Out
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4-215.name: Gyarados
A4-215.description:
Once it appears, it goes on a rampage.
It remains enraged until it demolishes
everything around it.

attacks.name: Wild Swing
attacks.effect: You may discard any number of your Benched {W} Pokémon. This attack does 40 more damage for each Benched Pokémon you discarded in this way.

A4-218.name: Magneton
A4-218.description:
Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic
force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

abilities.name: Volt Charge
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may take a {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

A4-217.name: Magnemite
A4-217.description:
The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units
at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which
allows it to float.

A4-216.name: Vaporeon
A4-216.description:
It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with
a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.effect: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

A4-219.name: Jolteon
A4-219.description:
It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted
by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Beginning Bolt
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon evolved during this turn, this attack does 20 more damage.

A4-222.name: Primeape
A4-222.description:
It becomes wildly furious if it even senses
someone looking at it. It chases anyone
that meets its glare.

attacks.name: Fight Back
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

A4-220.name: Misdreavus
A4-220.description:
This Pokémon startles people in the middle of
the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

A4-221.name: Mankey
A4-221.description:
It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of
its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.

attacks.name: Focus Fist
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A4-223.name: Nidoran♀
A4-223.description:
Females are more sensitive to smells than males.
While foraging, they'll use their whiskers to check
wind direction and stay downwind of predators.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.effect: Put 1 random Nidoran♂ from your deck onto your Bench.

A4-225.name: Nidoqueen
A4-225.description:
Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense.
With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield
its children from any kind of attack.

attacks.name: Lovestrike
attacks.effect: This attack does 50 more damage for each of your Benched Nidoking.

A4-224.name: Nidorina
A4-224.description:
The horn on its head has atrophied. It's thought
that this happens so Nidorina's children won't get
poked while their mother is feeding them.

A4-227.name: Nidorino
A4-227.description:
With a horn that's harder than diamond, this
Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it
searches for a moon stone.

A4-231.name: Eevee
A4-231.description:
Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to
adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.effect: Put a random Pokémon from your deck into your hand.

A4-228.name: Nidoking
A4-228.description:
When it goes on a rampage, it's impossible to
control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it's
lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A4-230.name: Lickitung
A4-230.description:
If this Pokémon's sticky saliva gets on you and
you don't clean it off, an intense itch will set in.
The itch won't go away, either.

A4-226.name: Nidoran♂
A4-226.description:
The horn on a male Nidoran's forehead contains
a powerful poison. This is a very cautious
Pokémon, always straining its large ears.

A4-229.name: Sneasel
A4-229.description:
This cunning Pokémon hides under the cover of
darkness, waiting to attack its prey.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.effect: Discard a random Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rampaging Whirlpool
attacks.effect: Discard a random Energy from among the Energy attached to all Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Scratching Nails
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has damage on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Magical Delusion
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sparking Gadget
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Licking Fury
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Forest Breath
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may take a {G} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your {G} Pokémon.

abilities.name: Snowy Terrain
abilities.effect: During Pokémon Checkup, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, do 10 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Phoenix Turbo
attacks.effect: Take a {R}, {W}, and {L} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach them to your Benched Basic Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Elemental Blast
attacks.effect: Discard a {R}, {W}, and {L} Energy from this Pokémon.

A4A-001.name: Hoppip
A4A-001.description:
Outside of cold regions, Hoppip can be found
practically everywhere. This is because the wind
carries this species all over the world.

A4A-002.name: Skiploom
A4A-002.description:
Skiploom enthusiasts can apparently tell where a
Skiploom was born by the scent drifting from the
flower on the Pokémon's head.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4A-004.name: Sunkern
A4A-004.description:
It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning.
Knowing it's weak, it simply feeds until it evolves.

A4A-005.name: Sunflora
A4A-005.description:
In the daytime, it rushes about in a hectic
manner, but it comes to a complete stop when
the sun sets.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Breeze-By Attack
attacks.effect: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4A-006.name: Celebi
A4A-006.description:
This Pokémon wanders across time. Grass and trees
flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.

attacks.name: Temporal Leaves
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an evolved Pokémon, devolve it by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

A4A-008.name: Slugma
A4A-008.description:
A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers
around in a constant search for warm places.

A4A-007.name: Durant
A4A-007.description:
They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel
armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

attacks.name: Mountain Munch
attacks.effect: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

A4A-009.name: Magcargo
A4A-009.description:
Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames
that circulate throughout its body.

abilities.name: Legendary Pulse
abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, draw a card.

attacks.name: Blazing Beatdown
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {R} Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

A4A-011.name: Fletchinder
A4A-011.description:
Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass
where bug Pokémon might be hiding and
then catches them as they come leaping out.

A4A-012.name: Talonflame
A4A-012.description:
It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies
around easily, even while carrying prey
that weighs more than 220 lbs.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

A4A-013.name: Poliwag
A4A-013.description:
For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking.
The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of
the Pokémon's innards showing through the skin.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.effect: Put 1 random Poliwag from your deck onto your Bench.

A4A-014.name: Poliwhirl
A4A-014.description:
Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness.
This trait of Poliwhirl's has been used in place of
lullabies to get children to go to sleep.

A4A-015.name: Tentacool
A4A-015.description:
Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer.
It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it
searches for prey.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

A4A-016.name: Tentacruel
A4A-016.description:
When the red orbs on Tentacruel's head glow
brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to
fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.

attacks.name: Stun Poison
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned and Paralyzed.

A4A-018.name: Slowking
A4A-018.description:
When its head was bitten, toxins entered Slowpoke's
head and unlocked an extraordinary power.

attacks.name: Litter
attacks.effect: Discard up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

A4A-017.name: Slowpoke
A4A-017.description:
It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five
seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

A4A-019.name: Jynx
A4A-019.description:
Its strange cries sound like human language.
There are some musicians who compose songs
for Jynx to sing.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Legendary Pulse
abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, draw a card.

attacks.name: Crystal Waltz
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

A4A-021.name: Feebas
A4A-021.description:
Although unattractive and unpopular, this
Pokémon's marvelous vitality has made it a
subject of research.

attacks.name: Leap Out
attacks.effect: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4A-022.name: Milotic
A4A-022.description:
Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists.
It has even been referred to as the most
beautiful Pokémon of all.

abilities.name: Healing Ripples
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may heal 60 damage from 1 of your {W} Pokémon.

A4A-023.name: Mantyke
A4A-023.description:
It's highly friendly and easily tamed. Tours that
take people swimming with Mantyke are a
super-popular beach activity.

attacks.name: Splashy Toss
attacks.effect: Take a {W} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Basic Pokémon.

A4A-024.name: Cryogonal
A4A-024.description:
Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said
that people and Pokémon who die on snowy
mountains are reborn into these Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.effect: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A4A-026.name: Tynamo
A4A-026.description:
While one alone doesn't have much power,
a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful
as lightning.

A4A-027.name: Eelektrik
A4A-027.description:
They coil around foes and shock them with
electricity-generating organs that seem simply
to be circular patterns.

abilities.name: Legendary Pulse
abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, draw a card.

attacks.name: Voltaic Bullet
attacks.effect: This attack also does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

A4A-030.name: Yamper
A4A-030.description:
This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with
their work because it wants treats. As it runs,
it crackles with electricity.

A4A-028.name: Eelektross
A4A-028.description:
They crawl out of the ocean using their arms.
They will attack prey on shore and immediately
drag it into the ocean.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

A4A-031.name: Boltund
A4A-031.description:
This Pokémon generates electricity and channels
it into its legs to keep them going strong.
Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.

attacks.name: Defiant Spark
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has damage on it, this attack can be used for 1 {L} Energy.

A4A-029.name: Stunfisk
A4A-029.description:
Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with
it, this Pokémon developed the organs it uses to
generate electricity.

A4A-032.name: Misdreavus
A4A-032.description:
This Pokémon startles people in the middle of
the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

abilities.name: Infiltrating Inspection
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, when you put this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may have your opponent reveal their hand.

A4A-033.name: Mismagius
A4A-033.description:
Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry
may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.

attacks.name: Cursed Prose
attacks.effect: At the end of your opponent's next turn, do 90 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

A4A-034.name: Galarian Corsola
A4A-034.description:
Watch your step when wandering areas oceans
once covered. What looks like a stone could be
this Pokémon, and it will curse you if you kick it.

A4A-035.name: Galarian Cursola
A4A-035.description:
Its shell is overflowing with its heightened
otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as
protection for this Pokémon's core spirit.

abilities.name: Perish Body
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, the Attacking Pokémon is Knocked Out.

A4A-036.name: Latias
A4A-036.description:
It communicates using telepathy. Its body is
covered in down that refracts light to make
it invisible.

attacks.name: Crossing Flights
attacks.effect: If Latios is on your Bench, this attack does 20 more damage.

A4A-037.name: Latios
A4A-037.description:
It understands human speech and is highly
intelligent. It is a tender Pokémon that
dislikes fighting.

abilities.name: Fantastical Floating
abilities.effect: If you have Latias in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.effect: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

A4A-038.name: Frillish
A4A-038.description:
It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws
it down to the deeps, five miles below the
ocean's surface.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.effect: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

A4A-040.name: Diglett
A4A-040.description:
It lives about one yard underground, where it
feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears
aboveground.

A4A-039.name: Jellicent
A4A-039.description:
Most of this Pokémon's body composition is
identical to sea water. It makes sunken ships
its lair.

A4A-041.name: Dugtrio
A4A-041.description:
Its three heads bob separately up and down to
loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it
to burrow.

attacks.name: Cliff Crumbler
attacks.effect: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a {F} Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

A4A-043.name: Phanpy
A4A-043.description:
This Pokémon lives and nests on a riverbank.
After playing in the mud, it won't be able to
settle down unless it washes its body.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.effect: This attack does damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon equal to the damage this Pokémon has on it.

attacks.name: Hydro Knuckle
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has any {W} Energy attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

A4A-044.name: Donphan
A4A-044.description:
Donphan is covered in tough hide, so even being
hit by a car won't faze this Pokémon. However, it
is extremely susceptible to rain.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

A4A-046.name: Dwebble
A4A-046.description:
It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock
breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it
locates a replacement.

A4A-045.name: Relicanth
A4A-045.description:
Rock-hard scales and oil-filled swim bladders
allow this Pokémon to survive the intense water
pressure of the deep sea.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

A4A-047.name: Crustle
A4A-047.description:
This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry
climates. It won't come out of its boulder on
rainy days.

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

A4A-049.name: Zorua
A4A-049.description:
It changes into the forms of others to surprise
them. Apparently, it often transforms into a
silent child.

A4A-048.name: Seviper
A4A-048.description:
Constant polishing makes the edge of the blade on
its tail extremely sharp. It's Zangoose's archrival.

attacks.name: Fateful Fang
attacks.effect: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Zangoose, this attack does 40 more damage.

A4A-050.name: Zoroark
A4A-050.description:
Stories say those who tried to catch Zoroark were
trapped in an illusion and punished.

abilities.name: Illusive Trickery
abilities.effect: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this Pokémon's attacks, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

A4A-052.name: Malamar
A4A-052.description:
Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly
induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer
under Malamar's control.

attacks.name: Mental Surge
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

A4A-053.name: Skrelp
A4A-053.description:
Skrelp evades its enemies by hiding amid
drifting seaweed. It eats rotten seaweed to
create its poison.

A4A-056.name: Farfetch'd
A4A-056.description:
The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves
as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire
situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

A4A-055.name: Altaria
A4A-055.description:
If it bonds with a person, it will gently envelop
the friend with its soft wings, then hum.

attacks.name: Dragon Arcana
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has 2 or more different types of Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

A4A-054.name: Dragalge
A4A-054.description:
Using a liquid poison, Dragalge indiscriminately
attacks anything that wanders into its territory.
This poison can corrode the undersides of boats.

A4A-051.name: Inkay
A4A-051.description:
It spins while making its luminescent spots flash.
These spots allow it to communicate with others
by using different patterns of light.

A4A-059.name: Igglybuff
A4A-059.description:
Its body has a faintly sweet scent and is bouncy
and soft. If it bounces even once, it cannot stop.

attacks.name: Sleepy Lullaby
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

A4A-060.name: Teddiursa
A4A-060.description:
Its paws are soaked in oodles of honey. When
nervous, Teddiursa will lick its paws and soon
have a smile back on its face.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

A4A-057.name: Lickitung
A4A-057.description:
If this Pokémon's sticky saliva gets on you and
you don't clean it off, an intense itch will set in.
The itch won't go away, either.

attacks.name: Stretch Tongue
attacks.effect: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A4A-058.name: Lickilicky
A4A-058.description:
Lickilicky's strange tongue can stretch to many
times the length of its body. No one has figured
out how Lickilicky's tongue can stretch so far.

attacks.name: Stretch Tongue
attacks.effect: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

A4A-061.name: Ursaring
A4A-061.description:
It usually wears a hardened expression, but when
it's licking up honey—which it loves—the joy it
feels will cause it to break into a wide grin.

A4A-062.name: Miltank
A4A-062.description:
Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it's
been supporting the lives of people and other
Pokémon since ancient times.

attacks.name: Rolling Frenzy
attacks.effect: Until this Pokémon leaves the Active Spot, this Pokémon's Rolling Frenzy attack does +30 damage. This effect stacks.

A4A-063.name: Azurill
A4A-063.description:
Its tail bounces like a rubber ball. It flings that tail
around to fight opponents bigger than itself.

attacks.name: Squishy Healing
attacks.effect: Heal 50 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4A-064.name: Swablu
A4A-064.description:
It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes
a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.

A4A-066.name: Fletchling
A4A-066.description:
This Pokémon is normally calm, but once it enters battle,
its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

A4A-065.name: Zangoose
A4A-065.description:
It's Seviper's archrival. To threaten those
it encounters, it fans out the claws on its
front paws.

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.effect: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, do 20 damage to the Attacking Pokémon.

A4A-070.name: Traveling Merchant
A4A-070.effect: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck. Put all Pokémon Tool cards you find there into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

A4A-069.name: Whitney
A4A-069.effect: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Miltank, and it recovers from being Asleep, Paralyzed, and Confused.

A4A-067.name: Inflatable Boat
A4A-067.effect: The Retreat Cost of the {W} Pokémon this card is attached to is 1 less.

A4A-068.name: Memory Light
A4A-068.effect: The Pokémon this card is attached to can use any attack from its previous Evolutions. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

A4A-072.name: Milotic
A4A-072.description:
Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists.
It has even been referred to as the most
beautiful Pokémon of all.

abilities.name: Healing Ripples
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may heal 60 damage from 1 of your {W} Pokémon.

A4A-073.name: Stunfisk
A4A-073.description:
Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with
it, this Pokémon developed the organs it uses to
generate electricity.

A4A-071.name: Morty
A4A-071.effect: For each of your {P} Pokémon in play, look at that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck and put them back in any order.

A4A-077.name: Azurill
A4A-077.description:
Its tail bounces like a rubber ball. It flings that tail
around to fight opponents bigger than itself.

attacks.name: Squishy Healing
attacks.effect: Heal 50 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4A-075.name: Latios
A4A-075.description:
It understands human speech and is highly
intelligent. It is a tender Pokémon that
dislikes fighting.

abilities.name: Fantastical Floating
abilities.effect: If you have Latias in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.effect: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Legendary Pulse
abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, draw a card.

attacks.name: Blazing Beatdown
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {R} Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

A4A-074.name: Yamper
A4A-074.description:
This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with
their work because it wants treats. As it runs,
it crackles with electricity.

attacks.name: Breeze-By Attack
attacks.effect: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

A4A-076.name: Phanpy
A4A-076.description:
This Pokémon lives and nests on a riverbank.
After playing in the mud, it won't be able to
settle down unless it washes its body.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.effect: This attack does damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon equal to the damage this Pokémon has on it.

abilities.name: Legendary Pulse
abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, draw a card.

attacks.name: Crystal Waltz
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

abilities.name: Legendary Pulse
abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, draw a card.

attacks.name: Voltaic Bullet
attacks.effect: This attack also does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Knuckle
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has any {W} Energy attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

A4A-083.name: Whitney
A4A-083.effect: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Miltank, and it recovers from being Asleep, Paralyzed, and Confused.

A4A-084.name: Traveling Merchant
A4A-084.effect: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck. Put all Pokémon Tool cards you find there into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Breeze-By Attack
attacks.effect: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Legendary Pulse
abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, draw a card.

attacks.name: Blazing Beatdown
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {R} Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

A4A-085.name: Morty
A4A-085.effect: For each of your {P} Pokémon in play, look at that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck and put them back in any order.

abilities.name: Legendary Pulse
abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, draw a card.

attacks.name: Voltaic Bullet
attacks.effect: This attack also does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Knuckle
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has any {W} Energy attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

A4A-093.name: Psyduck
A4A-093.description:
It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the
headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious
powers.

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.effect: Your opponent can't use any Supporter cards from their hand during their next turn.

abilities.name: Legendary Pulse
abilities.effect: At the end of your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, draw a card.

attacks.name: Crystal Waltz
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

A4A-092.name: Monferno
A4A-092.description:
